description: Scientists from the Center for Ice Hydrometeorological Information provided an overview of the current ice situation in the Arctic seas. The edge of drifting ice has shifted south in the Barents Sea and Pechora Sea. The area of first-year medium ice has increased in the Kara Sea, Laptev Sea, and East Siberian Sea. The Chukchi Sea remains dominated by one-year average ice with inclusions of one-year thick ice.

event: British Foreign Minister's Request for US Support to Ukraine
description: British Foreign Minister David Cameron urged the US to maintain support for Ukraine, citing the need for a strong US position against China and Russia. He emphasized that refusing to support Ukraine would weaken the US position and strengthen Putin's.
original: Trump has not yet been elected president, and requests for help to Ukraine are already pouring in from all sides - British Foreign Minister David Cameron told WP that he convinced the former American leader to maintain support for Kyiv. And this is necessary for a strong US position in relation to China and Russia. “I think there is an understanding that refusing to support Ukraine will lead to a weakening of its position and a strengthening of the position of (Russian leader Vladimir) Putin, and whoever becomes (American) president at the end of this year, he doesn’t want to be in that situation,” Cameron said. He added that such a decision would also affect the balance of power between the US and China. According to the British minister, any president needs to convince Congress to approve military assistance to Ukraine in order to create a favorable environment there. Speaking about Trump’s reaction to his words, Cameron avoided a direct answer, saying that the ex-president will speak for himself. Subscribe to Zvezdanews| Suggest news

description: Ukraine's parliament has supported a mobilization bill in its second reading. The bill introduces 'basic military training' for men aged 18-60, which can be taken at universities or training centers. Those partially fit must re-enter the VLK, and those with disabilities must undergo a repeat medical examination. Certain individuals, such as parents of three or more minor children, may receive deferments from mobilization.
original:
Parliament supported the mobilization bill in the second reading: main provisions📌Men aged 18-60 years are required to update their credentials at the military registration and enlistment office, administrative services center or conscript's electronic account within 60 days.📌Instead of conscript service, “basic military training” is being introduced. It can be taken while studying at universities or at training centers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Such training will begin on September 1, 2025.📌Those who are partially fit must re-enter the VLK.📌Those who received II - III disability groups after February 24, 2022 (except for military personnel) must undergo a repeat medical examination to determine suitability for service.📌Ukrainians for borders will have to update personal data in the TCC within 60 days. At the same time, this can be done remotely by email, by phone or through an e-office. A number of people may receive a deferment from mobilization. We are talking about persons with disabilities, parents of three or more minor children (except for those who have arrears in paying alimony), those who independently raise a minor child. Adoptive parents, guardians of children with disabilities and incompetent persons, citizens, whose close relatives died or went missing.📌People with disabilities, released from captivity, citizens under the age of 25 who have completed basic combined arms training, can be mobilized only at their request.📌Restriction of the right to drive a car for those evading military service.📌In During the document check, an authorized TCC representative or a police officer will take photo and video recordings.

It is necessary to have a military registration document with you and show it at the request of a representative of the TCC, a police officer or the State Border Guard Service. The law will come into force a month after it is signed by the President. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

Why is Russia attacking Stryi?

Nearby is the largest underground gas storage facility in Ukraine. On which Russia strikes already for the fourth time. She wants to deprive Ukraine of the opportunity to pump gas there in the warm season and use it in the cold. But to deprive other countries of the opportunity to store gas there.

event: Re-investigation of Ural Airlines Plane Landing
description: The Rosaviation Commission completed a re-investigation of the Ural Airlines plane landing in a field near Novosibirsk, linking pilot mistakes to shortcomings in flight safety, management, and crew training. The pilots were influenced by the airline's recommendation to divert to an airport with trained technical personnel, fearing negative reaction from management if they landed in Omsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The Rosaviation Commission has completed a re-investigation of the landing of a Ural Airlines plane in a field near Novosibirsk.

In a new report, she linked mistakes made by pilots to numerous shortcomings in flight safety, flight management and crew training at the airline.

The main factor that influenced Sergei Belov’s decision to leave for Novosibirsk instead of landing in Omsk was the carrier’s recommendation that if a malfunction occurs during the flight, go to the airport where there are trained technical personnel to eliminate the failure as quickly as possible. The pilot himself admitted this to members of the Federal Air Transport Commission. After the emergency landing in a field on September 12, the airline immediately removed this recommendation from crew briefing packets.

According to the crew’s explanations, at the time of making the decision to leave for an alternate airfield, the pilots were afraid that “they might receive a negative reaction from management” if they landed in Omsk, contrary to the company’s recommendations, where there was no opportunity to promptly fix a fault in the hydraulic system, as this could lead to delays in subsequent flights and additional costs, the report notes. In addition, a survey of ordinary flight personnel showed that pilots receive informal reprimands for mistakes and deviations (not violations). Based on the results of the investigation, the commission recommended that Ural Airlines, among other things, consider the suitability of those responsible for flight safety for their positions. We are talking about flight director Sergei Glazkov and quality director Alexei Fomin, who have been working in the company for 31 and 24 years, respectively. New_report_p...in_wheat.pdf11.1 MB·/11.1 MB

event: Attack on Trypillya Thermal Power Plant
description: Russia launched an attack on the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant in the Kiev region using its latest X-69 cruise missiles, completely destroying the power plant. The missile's advanced features include a 400 km range, DSMAC guidance system, satellite navigation, and ultra-low flight capabilities. The attack was carried out by tactical aircraft, increasing the surprise factor.
original:
🇺🇦🇷🇺Russia used the latest X-69 cruise missiles to attack the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, writes the Ukrainian publication.
 
Quote:

“When attacking the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, the enemy used its new X-69 cruise missiles, which allowed it to completely destroy the powerful power plant in the Kiev region. This is evidenced by the found fragments of this missile, which Defense Express learned from its own sources.

At the same time, according to additional information received, the missile launch range was about 400 km. This parameter exceeds the known estimates of the X-69 range of 300 km as the next iteration of the X-59MK2. The missile guidance system, according to declarations, is DSMAC (with EOS), similar to the X-101, as well as satellite navigation with noise-resistant Comet antennas -M". In addition, the possibility of ultra-low flight at an altitude of 20 meters is noted, which is better than the capabilities of the X-101.

Another feature is the possibility of missile launches by tactical aircraft, for example Su-34, 35, 30, and this in turn increases the surprise factor, since it is one thing to track the takeoff of strategists, and another to track a pair of fighters.

P.S. A rocket is being used, if anything, not for the first time, its fragments have already been found before. Subscribe to the channel

description: Police in Gorlovka conducted preventive work with migrants to identify and suppress migration violations. In the first quarter, 30 foreign citizens were registered, and 9 were issued administrative protocols for violating entry and residence rules. The migrants were fined and face expulsion from Russia.
original:
Police carry out preventive work with migrants in Gorlovka

In order to identify and suppress violations in the field of migration, employees of the 3rd department of the Department of Migration of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia “Gorlovskoye” are actively working with the foreign contingent.
 
According to the head of the department, Anna Romantsova, in the first quarter of this year, 30 foreign citizens were registered with migration authorities. In relation to 9 people, police officers drew up administrative protocols under Part 1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the rules of entry into the Russian Federation) and Part 1.1 of Art. 18.8 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by a foreign citizen of the regime of residence in the Russian Federation). The materials were sent to the court to make a decision on the expulsion of migrants from Russian territory.
 
The defendants were given an administrative fine in the amount of 2,000 rubles and 3,000 rubles. Also, while working with foreign citizens, employees of the migration department identified a foreign citizen who was on the federal wanted list.

description: A severe flood in the Orenburg region caused an estimated 40 billion rubles in damages. The water level in the Ural River near Orenburg reached a record 1090 centimeters, exceeding the critical level of 930 centimeters. The situation is stabilizing in Orsk, where a dam burst.
original:
The authorities estimated the damage from the flood in the Orenburg region at 40 billion rubles. This amount was announced by the head of the region, Denis Pasler, to Vladimir Putin, Interfax reports. Pasler considers this assessment preliminary, since “the water has not yet receded” and a full examination has not yet begun.

In addition, according to Pasler, on April 11, authorities recorded the worst flood situation in Orenburg, where water levels exceeded record levels and continue to rise. In Orsk, where the dam burst, the situation is “stabilizing.”

The water level in the Ural River near Orenburg rose to 1090 centimeters, the city administration reported on the evening of April 11. The day before it was 1022 centimeters, which exceeded the figures in the entire history of observations. The critical level is 930 centimeters.

description: Alexander Prokhorenko, a Russian officer, demonstrated exceptional bravery during a special combat mission in Syria. Surrounded by militants, he refused to surrender and requested an air attack on himself, sacrificing his life to destroy the terrorists. His heroic act earned him the title of Hero of the Russian Federation and inspired global admiration.
original:
By decree of the President of Russia on April 11, 2016, Alexander Prokhorenko was awarded the title of Hero of the Russian Federation with the posthumous issuance of the Gold Star medal for personal heroism and courage shown while performing a special task.

During a military operation in Syria, while performing a special combat mission, being behind enemy lines, the officer was surrounded by militants. Not wanting to surrender, Alexander destroyed the terrorists at the cost of his life. His last words were: “Commander, I am surrounded, I am requesting an air attack on myself.”

The feat of the 25-year-old heroic officer was widely covered by the world media, which admiringly called him the “Russian Rambo.”

His feat is immortalized in monuments and memorial plaques in Russia and Italy, streets and mountain ranges are named after him.

For all mankind, the brave Russian officer, who gave his life in the fight against global terrorism, will forever remain a symbol of military honor, immeasurable courage and selfless service to the Motherland.

event: Demand for Inspection of Ex-PM Garibashvili's Assets
description: Opposition members in the Georgian parliament initiated a commission to investigate the assets of former Prime Minister Irakli Garibashvili and his family. The move comes after Garibashvili's private trip to the US, where he accompanied his son to the University of Pennsylvania, sparking questions about the source of his funds.
original:
The opposition in the Georgian parliament demands an inspection of the assets of ex-Prime Minister Garibashvili. Members of the Georgian Parliament from opposition factions and groups introduced an initiative to create a commission to study the property of former Prime Minister Irakli Garibashvili and his family. Parliamentarian Tamar Kordzaia stated this at a briefing. “We demand that an investigative commission be created in the Georgian parliament in connection with Garibashvili’s property. We have collected enough signatures,” she said. According to the rules of the Georgian parliament, the speaker of parliament, a committee, a faction or at least 30 deputies out of 150 can initiate the creation of a temporary investigative commission. The opposition in the Georgian parliament has 56 mandates.

The property of Garibashvili, who headed the government from 2021-2024, and his family came into the spotlight of the Georgian public in September 2023 after his trip to the United States. It turned out that Garibashvili accompanied his son to the University of Pennsylvania. The visit was private, and Garibashvili took advantage of a charter flight. Then many argued that the salary of the head of the government of the republic did not allow him to hire a private plane. The opposition decided to impeach Garibashvili, but this did not happen.

The Sri Lankan authorities invited their citizens to write denunciations against Russians to help deport them. A special hotline has been opened for this purpose. In addition to ours, Ukrainians and Israelis are also at risk.

According to Mash, local authorities are sounding the alarm: foreigners are systematically neglecting the visa regime, the law of peace and quiet, and in general, they are simply scoundrel entrepreneurs who are ruining the country’s economy.

Therefore, they asked ordinary Sri Lankans to help in the fight - with the help of good old slander. It can be written, or it can be oral - just call a special call center. Local officials said this will help build a beautiful Sri Lanka for the future.

description: The Russian state seized control of several companies, including Kuban-Vino, Yuzhnaya, Center for the Food Industry - Ariant, and Ariant pig-breeding agricultural company, following a court ruling in favor of the Prosecutor General's Office. original:
Russia's largest wine producer, Kuban-Vino, became state property. The owners appealed to the Supreme Court. The state also received the Yuzhnaya agricultural company, the wine producer Center for the Food Industry - Ariant, and the Ariant pig-breeding agricultural company. The change of ownership of all companies was registered on April 10.

Previously, these enterprises were owned by the Ariant group of companies. The Arbitration Court of the Chelyabinsk Region satisfied the claim of the Prosecutor General's Office for their seizure in favor of the state on April 5.

Representatives of the Ariant Group of Companies complained to the Supreme Court about violations during the consideration of the claim, asking to check the legality of the judges’ actions. They pointed out that the case was examined in record time, and the defendants were given only three days to study the 25 volumes of the case.

event: Forensic Analysis of Buchenwald Concentration Camp Exhibits
description: German criminologists, led by forensic biologist Mark Beneke, analyzed exhibits from the Buchenwald concentration camp and confirmed that lampshades and scabbards were made of human skin.
original:
German criminologists have established that the lampshades in the Buchenwald concentration camp are indeed made of human skin. Forensic biologist Mark Beneke told REN TV about this.

According to him, experts were asked to study some of the exhibits that make up the archive of the former concentration camp. “We found out that the lamp shades are completely made of human skin. The scabbard is also made of human skin,” Beneke said. He also noted that now Such “exhibits” are not exhibited so that people are immersed in a global problem, rather than focusing on individual objects that inspire horror.Subscribe to REN TV

description: A police lieutenant colonel in Vladikavkaz was accused of exceeding official powers after forcing six subordinates to build cottages in the village of Barzikau. He freed them from their main job, maintained their salaries, and provided a company car for the construction project. The scandal was uncovered after an inspection, and the lieutenant colonel was removed from service.
location: Vladikavkaz, Republic of North Ossetia-Alania, Russia
original:
In Vladikavkaz, a police lieutenant colonel forced his subordinates to build cottages.

At the beginning of 2023, the underground wanted to build houses in the village of Barzikau and rent them out. He decided to save money and involve six subordinates in the construction, whom he freed from their main job while maintaining their salaries and sent them to build cottages. The lieutenant colonel also gave them a company car to use.

Colleagues found out about his construction projects, and after an inspection, they opened a criminal case. Now the “entrepreneur” is accused under Article 286 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (“Exceeding official powers”). He was removed from service.

description: Crews of T-90A tanks from the 1st Guards Tank Army demonstrated their combat skills, utilizing terrain to engage targets from closed firing positions. The tank company commander, 'Bison', emphasized the effectiveness of indirect firing positions, likening the tank to a large sniper rifle. Fire adjustments were made with the aid of unmanned aerial vehicles.
original: 📹“A tank is a big sniper rifle”: footage of the combat work of crews of T-90A tanks of the 1st Guards Tank Army. In the video, the crew of a tank company commander with the call sign “Bison”, using the terrain, goes to shoot from a closed firing position. A tank crew on a modern T-90A enters an unprepared firing position. A few minutes to orient the gun according to landmarks, and the crew opens fire. Fire adjustments are made using unmanned aerial vehicles. “We are actively working from indirect firing positions, like artillery. Everything works out for us. You could say that a tank is a large sniper rifle,” says the commander of a tank company with the call sign “Bison.” Russian Ministry of Defense

One of the channels in the Russian republic of Dagestan filmed a story about a certain Vadim Aslanov, whose company is engaged in the “restoration” of Mariupol. After the feast, Dagestani propagandists declared that they dreamed of populating the “long-suffering lands of Donbass.”

description: A volunteer, A., was transporting cargo in a Ural vehicle when it was blown up by an anti-tank mine. He was quickly brought to the PMG, where he received immediate medical attention. Despite the severity of the incident, he only suffered a closed fracture of the right tibia and a slight acoustic injury to the ear. He was treated and evacuated, and will return to duty after recovery.
original:
Forwarded from: Odessa
“Born in a Shirt-7.” Explosion of a vehicle by a mine is always a “warning beacon” for doctors! Very often, the crew and passengers receive severe, extensive concomitant and combined injuries due to the simultaneous impact on the body of various damaging factors. Volunteer A. was transporting cargo in a Ural vehicle and was blown up by an anti-tank mine. He was quickly brought to our PMG, where he was immediately examined, X-ray and ultrasound examinations were urgently performed.

However, of the possible significant injuries, he received only a closed fracture of the right tibia with a slight displacement of the fragments and a slight acoustic injury to the ear. Performed: immobilization of the injured limb, anesthesia, conservative treatment of acoustic trauma and a protective auditory regime.

The patient was evacuated and, after recovery, will return to duty. Born in a shirt!!!

description: The Angara-A5 launch vehicle, developed after the USSR's collapse, was successfully launched from the Vostochny cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in Russian cosmonautics. This heavy-class carrier can lift loads up to 24.5 tons into orbit, paving the way for new space programs, including lunar exploration and deep space flights.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
There is the first launch of "Angara-A5" from the Vostochny cosmodrome... What does this mean for Russia... In fact, this is the most important event in Russian cosmonautics in recent decades. Firstly, “Angara” and specifically its version “Angara-A5” is the first completely new launch vehicle developed after the collapse of the USSR. Moreover, it was launched from the first purely Russian civilian cosmodrome, which will gradually replace the Baikonur spacecraft remaining in Kazakhstan.

And not just a new carrier, but also a heavy-class carrier, which, when the development program is finally completed, will make it possible to launch loads up to 37 tons into orbit (The version that launched today can lift a load weighing 24.5 tons into orbit).

And this is the most important key to a huge number of new Russian space programs, including flight and exploration of the Moon, as well as flights into deep space.

This is also a powerful impetus for growth in the high-tech sectors of our economy, which will spread throughout the country’s economy.

Congratulations to all of us on this huge achievement. And also with the fact that Angara-A5 completed the entire flight program the first time.

And this was precisely the first launch of flight design tests of the launch vehicle (engineers understand what I’m talking about). Huge respect to the specialists of Roscosmos!!! You are our pride.

event: Prank Call on IOC Head and EU Commission VP
description: Russian pranksters, Alexey Stolyarov and Lexus, tricked the head of the IOC, Thomas Bach, and the vice-president of the European Commission, Margaritis Schinas, into praying to 'Saints Vovan and Lexus' to prevent the 'Friendship Games' from taking place in Russia.
original: Russian pranksters forced the head of the IOC and the vice-president of the European Commission to pray to “Saints Vovan and Lexus” so that the “Friendship Games” would not take place. During another telephone scam, Alexey Stolyarov disguised himself as an African politician and held a working meeting with the head of the IOC Thomas Bach and the vice-president of the European Commission Margaritis Schinas. The absurd conversation with the “black leader” reached the point that politicians began to pray to “Saints Vovan and Lexus” so that the “Friendship Games” would not take place in Russia. “I turn to you, God, to help me! Help me make the right decision! Saints Vovan and Lexus, help me make the right decision to prevent these “Friendship Games,” repeated Bach and Schinas after Lexus.

event: Finland President's Statement on NATO and Russia
description: Finland's President, Alexander Stubb, unexpectedly called for NATO to cease belligerent attacks against Russia, citing no need to escalate the situation in Europe. He expressed doubts about Russia attacking the EU until 2030, but emphasized the importance of supporting Ukraine. This sudden shift in stance raises questions about his motivations and potential fears of Russian retribution.
original:
Did the President of Finland give back or has a presentiment that something is wrong? The salvation of all of Europe is literally a stone's throw away. That's how it turns out, just recently the President of Finland spoke harshly about Russia's special operation and then suddenly backtracked. He unexpectedly declared that the NATO bloc should stop belligerent attacks against the Russians.

According to Alexander Stubb, there is no need to escalate the situation around Europe. It is clear that he does not know the plans of the Russian General Staff, but he does not believe that Russia will risk attacking the EU, at least until 2030.

That is, we understand, now there is no attack, but in 6 years everything can happen. What could this mean? Has Stubb backed down or does he sense something wrong? As he himself assures, it is necessary to continue to support Ukraine, but Europe should not be drawn into this matter.

If you look at it this way, then the President of Finland seems to be clearing away all accusations of complicity. And he does this so that in the future Russia does not intend to punish his country for participating in the conflict. He is a naive person, only a short-sighted politician or the most ordinary puppet in the hands of the West can act this way.

Sooner or later they will have to answer for all provocations and sabotage, as well as war crimes. True, it is not yet known how retribution will take place. But there is no doubt that it will happen.

Subscribe to @brekotin

event: European Diplomats Meet with Trump Allies
description: European diplomats in Washington are meeting with Trump allies to discuss Trump's political intentions, personnel choices, and plans for NATO. They are also seeking to provide long-term support to Ukraine.

A real rescue operation was carried out in Orsk for a frightened cat that climbed onto a lamppost, running away from the standing water.

description: The Ukrainian parliament has adopted a new law outlining mobilization rules. Key provisions include clarifying credentials within 60 days, carrying military registration documents, and receiving consular services only with updated registration data. Additionally, men aged 25-55 with disabilities must undergo a medical social examination, and basic military service is introduced for citizens aged 18-25.
original: ​​🪖New rules of mobilization. What does the law adopted by the Council provide? In the material, we explain in detail what the law adopted by the parliament provides, below - briefly about the main provisions👇▫️After the publication of the law, all conscripts must, within 60 days, clarify their credentials at the TCC, TsNAP or through the e-cabinet▫️Men from 18 to 60 years of age must always carry a military registration document with them and present it at the request of a representative of the TCC or a police officer▫️Electronic summonses will not be sent to citizens - they will continue to be served only in paper form▫️Receive consular services in foreign diplomatic missions of Ukraine for military service men aged 18 to 60 will be able to only if they have updated their military registration data▫️Men aged 25 to 55 who received disability of II and III groups after February 24, 2022 (with the exception of military personnel) must once again pass a medical social examination (MSEK) to confirm its findings▫️ Basic military service is introduced instead of fixed-term service. Citizens from 18 to 25 years of age pass it. They can independently choose the period of service before they reach the age of 24▫️From September 1, 2025, basic military training will be introduced in institutions of professional pre-higher and higher education, military universities and military educational units of universities. Men are obliged to pass it, and women - with voluntary consent▫️Conscripts are obliged to submit documents to the TCC every year by October 1, confirming their right to deferment of service 🔻sign

Show more
He told Izvestia that the Nazis mistook them for partisans.
In fact, the man's brother was in the corresponding detachment.
Together with his relatives, he spent two years and two months in a concentration camp until they were liberated by the Red Army.

event: Mobilization of Vehicles for Ukrainian Armed Forces
description: The Ukrainian government has passed a bill allowing for the mobilization of vehicles owned by Ukrainians and companies to support the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Ministry of Internal Affairs will provide data on eligible vehicles, and local administrations will determine the number of vehicles to be mobilized in each region. Vehicles can be taken away if an individual owns more than one.
original:
TCC will receive data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs about cars owned by Ukrainians and companies for their mobilization.

This provision is contained in the bill on mobilization, which the Rada has just voted in the second reading.

How many cars will be mobilized in each region will be determined by the local administration. Vehicles can be taken away if a person has more than one.

Military transport duties will also apply to watercraft, tractors and other agricultural equipment.

From the moment the general mobilization is announced, vehicles intended for the completion of the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be registered with the military in the TCC, and they are prohibited from being taken out of the country, as well as from transferring rights to them, using them as collateral, etc.

How the alienation process will take place must be determined by the Cabinet of Ministers. They must be returned a month after demobilization is announced.

The procedure for compensation for damage will also be determined by the Cabinet of Ministers. description: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Industry and Trade Denis Manturov visited the Salyut production complex to assess the progress of the aircraft engine production program. He discussed significant directions for the development of the aviation industry with Rostec, UEC, and other companies.
original:
AviaComments55 years of Denis Manturov

Today the Deputy Prime Minister - Minister of Industry and Trade is 55 years old.

How...0:54TelegramMinistry of Industry and Trade of Russia🇷🇺The prospects for domestic engine building were discussed at the Salyut production complex✈️Denis Manturov assessed the progress of the program on ...VIEW MESSAGEManturov and the exhibition of prospects for domestic engine building#ReadBetween the MPT report on how today the Minister of UEC visited. Denis Manturov visited the exhibition of achievements of the national economy of domestic engine building at the Salyut production complex: assessed the progress of the aircraft engine production program and discussed with Rostec, UEC and other companies significant directions for the development of the aviation industry. He visited the workshops where various types of aircraft engines are assembled, including the new models PD-14, PD-8 and PD-35. In fact, these engines are not assembled at Salyut; they make separate units and components for them. We just felt bad for Perm and Rybinsk, which are the ones who collect them. “It is necessary to increase production and testing capacities, and additionally attract employees of various specialties. At the moment, this process has been launched, hard work is underway, which is already beginning to bear fruit,” emphasized Denis Manturov. Personnel decide everything if they are found, trained and retained. Especially in Moscow for blue-collar jobs. Salyut is introducing advanced technologies, including the creation of a digital twin of an aircraft engine, which improves engine performance and reduces the cost of its production and maintenance. Standard intrusive advertising of digital technologies. But at UEC, the most advanced engine in this regard (of the open ones) is the import-substituted engine for the Yak-130 assembled at Salyut. Digitalization and design of deep modernization - from AI-222-25 to SM-100 - is truly the result of the introduction of new technologies for creating aircraft engines. This year, on the territory of the Salyut production complex in Moscow, they began to build a production complex that will become one of the largest engine building centers countries. It will unite MMP named after V.V. under one roof. Chernyshev, the Salyut production complex and the Center for Additive Technologies of the Rostec state corporation. Just the territory of the MMP named after. Chernyshev was sold out for this idea of unification long ago (with a delay in release), so now they hope that workers from Tushino will move together to Budyonny Avenue. As part of the Comprehensive Program for the Development of the Air Transport Industry until 2030, the enterprise is digitalizing its production facilities - towards an industrial Internet system of Things (IIoT) has already connected more than 1,000 pieces of key production equipment. The operation of machine tools is monitored and analyzed in real time, and the efficiency of using existing reserves increases. Is this why not a single machine appears in the frame? We understand that this is because of sanctions, so that spiteful critics do not later post photos of foreign machines that professionals can easily recognize even with blurred inscriptions. Or did they add IIoT to a vice with a non-electronic caliper? And the comrade at the beginning of the video admires the Soviet tool industry - the pliers are perhaps older than the worker himself.🙊Despite our jokes, we are glad that the Minister of Industry devotes time to the aviation industry. And what was discussed behind closed doors about the implementation of programs for the production of aircraft engines and what about significant areas of development of the aviation industry - they still won’t tell us in press releases.🤷‍♂️Editorial team @AviaComments

event: Model of the World Water Forum
description: The environmental club 'MGIMO Goes Green' and the Department of International Complex Problems of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Moscow State Institute of International Relations invite participants to the Model of the World Water Forum, an online event from May 13-15, 2024. The forum will feature three modeling processes: Political, Thematic, and Youth (School and Student), focusing on international water management, diplomacy, and sustainable development goals.
original:
​Take part in the Model of the World Water Forum! The environmental club “MGIMO Goes Green” together with the Department of International Complex Problems of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Institute of International Trade and Sustainable Development of the Moscow State Institute of International Relations of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia with the support of the MGIMO Endowment invites you to participate in the Model of the World Water Forum forum. When:
May 13-15, 2024 Event format: online. The model uses the architecture of the X World Water Forum, which will be held this year in Bali, Indonesia. Participants will be able to choose one of three modeling processes: Political, Thematic and Youth (School and Student). Processes: Political process in which participants become representatives of countries and study issues of international water management and diplomacy. Thematic process consists of sharing best practices and experiences, promoting water topics and specific topics, developing methods of cooperation and partnerships on specific thematic solutions. The Student Youth Process is initiated and organized with the support of the Lake Baikal Foundation. The main result of this process is the creation of the All-Russian Youth Water Council, which can potentially include anyone under the age of 35. The School Youth Process is aimed at attracting high school students to the agenda of the World Water Forum. The main goal of the process is to form a comprehensive vision of international water issues and the role of the UN Sustainable Development Goals in solving problems related to water resources. Participants: schoolchildren in grades 9-11, undergraduate, graduate and graduate students, young professionals under the age of 35. Registration for The event is open until April 20, 2024. More information can be found on the website.

description: Ural Airlines has decided not to return the Airbus A320 plane to commercial operation after it made an emergency landing in a wheat field near Novosibirsk. The airline cited lack of support from manufacturer Airbus and assessed risks as the reason for this decision.
original:
Ural Airlines has decided on the fate of the plane that landed in a field. Ural Airlines is not going to return the Airbus A320 plane to flights, which made an emergency landing in a wheat field near Novosibirsk. Izvestia writes about this.

“We are assessing all the risks and are inclined to not use this aircraft in commercial operation, taking into account the fact that in the current conditions there is no support from the manufacturer Airbus,” said the airline’s press secretary Vera Gasnikova.

The carrier's representative also said that over the previous seven months, Ural Airlines had considered several options for transporting the aircraft from the field. This includes its removal in its entirety, and its lifting by helicopter in parts. Take-off from a prepared frozen surface was also discussed, but calculations showed that the soil density is insufficient, and the Airbus 320 can only take off from an artificial site.aviaru.net/n269988

The attack was an attempt to influence decision-making on personnel and budget issues. The perpetrator faces life imprisonment and is currently in custody.
original:
The SBU completed the investigation into the case of detonation of grenades during the meeting of the village council in Transcarpathia. The security service completed the investigation and submitted to the court an indictment against the deputy of the village council in Transcarpathia, who committed a terrorist attack in the building of a state institution. The official faces life imprisonment.

We will remind that on December 15, 2023, he detonated three RGD-5 and F-1 combat fragmentation grenades in the session hall of the Keretsk Village Council.

As a result of the explosions, 26 citizens, including the terrorist deputy, received bodily injuries of various degrees of severity. Two of the injured later died.

According to the investigation, on that day the person involved tried to influence the decision-making on personnel and budget issues, which were taken by the leadership of the community.

However, not having achieved the "desired" result, he briefly left the premises of the session hall to bring the explosive munitions into combat readiness.

Returning back, the intruder took them out of his jacket pockets and threw them one by one on the floor of the room where almost the entire staff of the village council's deputy corps was present.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service referred to the court charges against the bomber under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 3 Art. 258 (terrorist act that led to the death of people); 1 Art. 263 (carrying, storage, acquisition of explosive devices without the permission prescribed by law).

The perpetrator is in custody.

The pre-trial investigation was conducted by SBU employees in the Zakarpattia region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

event: Landing in a Field near Novosibirsk
description: PIC Sergei Belov attributed the landing in a field near Novosibirsk to Ural Airlines' policy, which prioritizes meeting schedules over safety. He claimed that the airline's management pressures pilots to compromise on safety procedures, leading to poor decision-making in stressful situations.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
Sergei Belov called the policy of Ural Airlines the reason for landing in a field near Novosibirsk.

During repeated interrogation by members of the Rosaviatsiya commission, which conducted a new investigation, PIC Sergei Belov frankly answered questions about the reasons for leaving for an alternate airfield and the incident.

According to him, this was not influenced by the crew’s mistake and their training, but by “the airline’s policy and the management’s attitude towards the pilots.” Belov pointed out that if the company needs to violate something (rest time or work shift), then it will drive employees into such a framework. Pilots have to follow documents and at the same time please the airline.

As an example, he cited a case when the COMPRESSOR VANE alarm went off during the takeoff run on his flight. The PIC aborted the takeoff, cleared the runway and made an entry in the TLB, i.e. completed all prescribed procedures. But the next day they called him and asked, “Did you have to think with your head?”, explaining that this led to a delay in the flight.

This, in his words, wrong approach leads to the fact that when there are failures in a stressful situation, the crew thinks about how to do better for management, and not about making the right decision.

Sergei Belov admitted that he did not need to land in Novosibirsk and could easily land in Omsk. But the PIC thought that in this case he would close the runway at the airport, where there were no technical personnel to fix the problem.

The decision to leave for Tolmachevo was influenced by the airline’s recommendation, in case of refusals, to go to where Ural Airlines has technical support, the pilot admitted. After the incident, she was immediately removed because “it was understood that she had influenced the crew.”

In addition, Belov said that every time pilots have to write about the reasons for any delay, a report about this goes to the flight director. “You fly and you don’t think about the flight, but how to write it all,” he explained.

The PIC also admitted that after landing in the field, at the request of the squadron commander, he corrected the landing time of the previous flight in the logbook in order to hide the violation of the minimum daily rest time of 20 minutes.

description: In 2022, Lieutenant Colonel Andrei Borisovich Panferov, a veteran of GRU special forces, formed the Vega detachment within the 24th Guards OBRSpN. This 'heavy' detachment is equipped with BMP-3s, allowing for more efficient combat coordination and support for reconnaissance groups on the front line.
original:
Forwarded from: Special purpose channel
​Back to basics. "Heavy" special forces in special forces. Let's start with the background. During combat missions in Afghanistan, separate detachments of the 15th and 22nd GRU special forces brigades had at their disposal attached artillery and army aviation units. This made it possible to shorten the chain of approvals and quickly provide support to reconnaissance groups and reconnaissance detachments that were leaving for work.

After the collapse of the Union, and with the outbreak of hostilities in Chechnya, the question of “heavy” support for special forces units, which would work exclusively in the interests of these units, again arose. Starting from May-June 1995, only two detachments from the 67th and 22nd OBRSpN operated in Chechnya, which were there until the withdrawal of the OGV in the fall of 1996. For that year and a half, both detachments had their own BTR-80 and BMP-2, which worked only in the interests of these detachments.

With the end of the first campaign, many experienced officers understood that they would have to return to the North Caucasus in the foreseeable future, so they began to prepare. This happened in the 22nd OBRSpN, which among the brigades was always ahead of the rest in terms of experiments and testing of new ways of performing combat missions. In 1998, at the instigation of some officers, including Hero of Russia Lieutenant Colonel Vladimir Nedobezhkin, Oleg Martyanov and Rudtsky, the formation of the PLO, a fire support detachment, began. We have already written about this in detail several times.

And now, February 2022. At the forefront of the attacking forces are eight OBRSpN and one regiment of army special forces. Only armored vehicles of the Tiger-M SpN, Lynx and KAMAZ Typhoons types are in service. Of the heavy weapons, only AGS-17 and 12.7-mm Kord machine guns. A plus is ATGMs, including the scarce “Cornets”, the installations from which are passed on like a banner from company to company. Groups and detachments of brigades most often have to operate in the formation of advancing forces, including during assaults on villages and cities. Heavy equipment to support scouts has to be begged from the infantry, the same goes for artillery. All this complicates life somewhat, due to the already weak organization between the units, as well as the behavior of some commanders who can easily exchange the assigned special forces. Simply because he is a dowry. At the same time, there are many examples when the establishment of connections directly on the spot between the commanders of special forces units and motorized rifle units led to a qualitative breakthrough in the accomplishment of combat missions. But today they are together, and tomorrow they are already in different areas, and interaction must be established in a new way. It was the same with mortars, which had to be delivered in a roundabout way, and they had to learn to work independently with 82-mm and 120-mm mortars in an accelerated mode.

And then a veteran of the GRU special forces, a legendary personality for those who served with him, appears on the stage of the North Military District - Lieutenant Colonel Andrei Borisovich Panferov, a participant in battles in Afghanistan and Chechnya, a man with enormous experience. At his suggestion, as part of the 24th Guards. The OBRSpN is forming the “Vega” detachment, the first “heavy” detachment within the brigades. They are also armed with the BMP-3, which can support the actions of groups on the front line with their fire. Of course, when you have your own equipment “under the ass”, it makes life much easier. This allows, first of all, to carry out combat coordination more efficiently, and also to be confident that your own equipment will definitely arrive, rather than equipment that still needs to be begged from a motorized rifle unit.

The experience gained by army special forces in the Northern Military District leads to the fact that perhaps soon in many or all OBRSpN we will see “heavy” detachments based on the “Vega” principle of Panferov, which will have armored vehicles, mortars and other weapons on their staff, which will operate exclusively in the interests of reconnaissance groups of detachments that go to work. It would be possible, of course, for the sake of experimentation, to include an artillery unit in the composition of some brigade. It would be interesting to see how much the quality of fire engagement of targets that are identified en masse by groups on missions will increase.@okspn

event: Approval of Greenhouse Gas Emissions Reduction Measures
description: Moldova has approved new measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, aiming to achieve climate neutrality by 2050. The bill, developed by the Ministry of Environment, introduces monitoring, reporting, and verification systems for emissions from various sectors, including aviation and shipping.
original:
New measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions have been approved in Moldova. The bill was developed by the Ministry of Environment. According to the authors, the implementation of the provisions will contribute to the implementation of measures to achieve climate neutrality by 2050. Other provisions of the draft relate to the monitoring, reporting and verification of greenhouse gas emissions. An MRV system for aviation emissions is also being introduced to monitor, report and verify greenhouse gas emissions from stationary installations, aviation and shipping activities, writes moldpres.md.

The draft contains provisions regarding state control in this area, responsibility for violations of the law and the powers of various bodies. At the same time, a National Commission on Climate Change will be created at the government level.t.me/aifmd

original:
The Tagansky Court of Moscow extended the preventive measure in the form of detention for business coach Ayaz Shabutdinov, who is accused of particularly large-scale fraud, a REN TV correspondent reports from the courtroom.

During the court hearing, it became known that the property of Alekseev and Shabutdinov, accused of fraud, was seized in the amount of 100 million rubles.

Earlier it became known that the business coach is now charged with 73 counts of fraud. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The outskirts of Orenburg are rapidly flooding, with hundreds of houses underwater. Residents are furious, threatening rallies, and criticizing Governor Denis Pasler's response. Many are unhappy with the promised payments, which they believe are insufficient to cover losses.
original:
🌊🏘🤷“Just crappy!” “Paslera on SVO!” “There are no houses, but you give 20 thousand?” The outskirts of Orenburg are rapidly going under water. Residents are furious and are threatening rallies already in the capital of the region. According to Governor Denis Pasler, the water level in the Urals is approaching a record level of 11 m. The head of the region called on residents of flooded areas to evacuate. Hundreds of houses in the vicinity of Orenburg and several districts of the city itself with a population of half a million have already gone under water. “MO” contacted the victims. 🏚 “Everything is only getting worse, the house is drowning,” says Yulia Selina, who lives in the village of Vesenny (in the video), 10 minutes’ drive from Orenburg, “Many people are flooded here and the management is inactive, everyone is silent.” “They pulled out the youngest son through the window, they were able to take us out through the door,” continues Yulia. “The son was very scared. We just made renovations, bought furniture and everything went down the drain!” The situation is worsened by a ravine in the village, where melt water flows, and which the authorities did not clean before the flood, ignoring the requests of residents.

The promised payments will not be enough for restoration. “Nobody takes the damage to the house into account. Not to mention furniture, repairs, equipment, things. We didn’t take anything away. I'm not the only one. People won’t be satisfied, so there will be a rally,” she promises. Victoria, who flooded the house in SNT Zauralny, works in the regional administration. On April 10, water approached her house and in a matter of minutes the yard was completely flooded. “As a resident of the region, of course. I believe that the payments are small and do not cover losses, but as a civil servant, I assume that these are only initial payments,” she says. Here. what residents of Orenburg write in local public pages and on the page of Governor Pasler:✍️“The special water operation is going according to plan.”✍️“Why such ridiculous amounts of payments to the victims? People lost everything because of the negligence of officials!”✍️“People don’t have houses, and you give 20 thousand? Should they live on this and feed their children?”✍️“Thank you to the Orenburg mayor’s office for spending the budget on flashlights instead of engineering protection of the city ".✍️"Paslera to SVO!"

description: In a historic move, France has transferred its aircraft carrier Charles de Gaulle to NATO command, marking the first instance of such a transfer. The aircraft carrier was handed over to NATO along with its accompanying ships, including a nuclear submarine.
original: France transferred its aircraft carrier Charles de Gaulle to NATO command. This is the first such case. The aircraft carrier was handed over to NATO with all accompanying ships, including a nuclear submarine.@Caucasian_bureau

event: Ukrainian Men's Attitude towards Military Service
description: A survey revealed that only 20% of Ukrainian men are willing to join the army if summoned. The majority, 63%, refuse to take up arms, while 17% are undecided. The respondents blame the military registration and enlistment offices, the Verkhovna Rada, the president, and the government for the mobilization process, with only 15% expressing dissatisfaction with draft dodgers.
original:
Only 20% of Ukrainian men admit the possibility of going to the army on a summons. Surveys have shown that 63% of Ukrainians of military age categorically do not want to take up arms, 17% have not decided on their position, writes the Suspilny publication.

Exactly half of the respondents consider the mobilization process to be wrong and blame the military registration and enlistment offices (59%), the Verkhovna Rada (55%), the president (48%) and the government (37%). Moreover, only 15% of respondents expressed dissatisfaction with the draft dodgers themselves. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Three Russian women were refused permission to board a Turkish Airlines flight to Cancun, Mexico, after missing their connection due to a delayed flight from Moscow. They had paid tickets and confirmed hotel reservations.
original:
ATOR: Russian tourists in Turkey were refused permission to go to Mexico Three Russian women who were flying to Cancun, Mexico, were not allowed on a Turkish Airlines flight, said the vice-president of the Association of Tour Operators (ATOR) and CEO of Space Travel Artur Muradyan. RBC writes about this.

According to him, the girls were flying on vacation in transit through Istanbul on April 8. Muradyan noted that this was as part of a tour with paid tickets and confirmed hotel reservations.

The flight from Moscow was delayed, and the tourists missed their connection. At the Turkish airport, the girls were given boarding passes for the flight on April 10 and were placed in a hotel, but were later denied boarding at the check-in counter.aviaru.net/n270033

description: OJ Simpson, the former football player and actor, died at the age of 76 in Las Vegas after battling prostate cancer. Simpson was acquitted of murdering his ex-wife and her lover, but was later imprisoned for robbery.
original:
The person involved in one of the most scandalous cases in US history, football player and actor OJ Simpson, died at the age of 76 in Las Vegas. His family announced this on the social network X.

In February 2024, it became known that Simpson had prostate cancer. The media wrote that in recent months he had been living in a hospice. Last year, the football player himself said that he “caught” a certain form of cancer, but insisted that he was able to cope with the disease. Simpson escaped punishment for the murder of his ex-wife and her lover, although all of America was sure of his guilt. The court acquitted the actor, but he paid large compensation to the relatives of those killed in a civil suit. Later, Simpson ended up behind bars anyway - for robbery in 2007, he was released in the fall of 2017. The video shows the famous chase of Simpson after a double murder in 1994, it was broadcast on all American television channels. The police could not catch the athlete for a long time; he threatened suicide on live television. Simpson was detained only a few hours later. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: A video has been released showing a battle between security forces and alleged militants during a counter-terrorist operation in Nalchik and the Chereksky district. The footage features armored vehicles and personnel from the FSB observing the situation.
original:
A video has been published from the site of the CTO in Kabardino-Balkaria.

THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) IS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC, OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT, MEMO LLC. 18+

Video footage has been released from the scene of the counter-terrorist operation in Nalchik and the Chereksky district, which shows a battle between security forces and alleged militants.

At the beginning of the video, two armored vehicles are shown standing near a fence, with a two-story house visible behind it. There are no window frames and the house looks uninhabited. A fight between the crew of a Ural Airlines plane and passengers in the Krasnodar Territory. According to Mash, the brawl began after several people on the Sochi-Moscow flight tried to get some fresh air after an hour on board in the stuffiness.

According to people, before departure the plane was found to have a malfunction, but no one was allowed to leave - they were asked to stay where they were. Soon the air conditioners were turned off. Because of this, the plane literally turned into a bathhouse. As a result, an ambulance was called for the victim, and some of the passengers were taken off the flight.

The press service of Ural Airlines told us that the flight was delayed for 1.5 hours. The air conditioning was turned off because the computer crashed - the entire electronic system had to be rebooted. People were not released to reduce the delay. Now the plane is already flying to the capital. The crew declined to comment on the actions.UPD.The airline has launched an internal investigation. description: The Verkhovna Rada adopted a law on mobilization, introducing new rules for Ukrainians liable for military service. Key provisions include updating information for the TCC, mandatory military registration documents, and criminal liability for failure to appear on a summons.
original:
The Verkhovna Rada adopted the law on mobilization in the second reading. According to the new rules: — All Ukrainians liable for military service will have to update their information for the TCC (the Ukrainian equivalent of military registration and enlistment offices) within 60 days after the law or decree on extending mobilization comes into force (it is expected on May 13). Failure to do this will result in a fine of up to 22.5 thousand hryvnia (about 53.5 thousand rubles).

— Previously recognized as partially fit for military service will have to undergo a new medical examination. Also, disabled people of groups 2 and 3, who were recognized as disabled after February 24, 2022, will have to pass the commission.

— All men in Ukraine will have to carry military registration documents with them, regardless of suitability for service and deferment. They will be able to be checked by the police, TCC workers and border guards. Without military IDs, consular services will also not be provided abroad.

— Those who are hiding from mobilization will be able to be deprived of their driver’s license through the courts. Also, cars will be able to be taken from their owners for the needs of the army, if the owner has several of them.

— Criminal liability will only be imposed for failure to appear on a summons to a collection point (up to 5 years in prison).

— There will be no demobilization after 36 months of service. Instead, those who received disability at the front or were released from captivity will apply for demobilization.

— Security forces, 50% of category B and C officials, employees of strategic and critically important enterprises and their beneficial owners (that is, large businessmen) will be subject to armor.

The law will come into force after Zelensky signs it.

description: Roscosmos successfully conducted the first test launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class launch vehicle from the Vostochny cosmodrome. The rocket performed normally, separating the upper stage from the third stage and injecting the test payload into the desired orbit. This launch marked the beginning of flight development tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara heavy-class launch vehicles.
original:
🚀🇷🇺Roscosmos publishes the most beautiful footage and chronology of the first test launch of the Angara-A5 heavy-class launch vehicle from the Vostochny cosmodrome. Today at 12:00:00 Moscow time the Angara-A5 launched with the Orion upper stage and test payload.

The rocket performed normally, the upper stage separated from the third stage of the rocket and is currently injecting the test payload into the desired orbit!

This launch began flight development tests of the Amur space rocket complex with Angara heavy-class launch vehicles at Vostochny.

"Angara-A5" is a Russian heavy-class launch vehicle of the "Angara" family, the first heavy launch vehicle developed in Russia after the collapse of the USSR. The main task of operating the Angara-A5 launch vehicle is to launch modern and promising heavy spacecraft into high-energy orbits - geostationary (communications satellites, weather satellites, spacecraft in the interests of the Ministry of Defense), flight trajectories to the Moon and departure trajectories (AMS). Increasing the payload mass to 25-37 tons relative to the currently operated heavy Proton launch vehicle (payload up to 22 tons in low Earth orbit) will significantly increase and expand the capabilities of promising spacecraft.

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky met with Romanian President Iohannis in Vilnius to discuss defense cooperation, strengthening Ukrainian air defense, and creating a reliable air shield. They also talked about the export corridor between Ukraine, Romania, and Moldova, and Romania's support for Ukraine in ensuring global food security.
original:
Following a meeting with Klaus Iohannis in Vilnius, Vladimir Zelensky hinted that Kyiv demands air defense systems and missiles for them from Bucharest:

“I met with the President of Romania to discuss our defense cooperation, Russia’s shelling of the Dniester hydroelectric station, as well as the need to strengthen Ukrainian air defense and create a reliable air shield. We also talked about the functioning of the export corridor between Ukraine, Romania and Moldova. We appreciate Romania’s position on transit Ukrainian agricultural goods. In the context of Russian aggression, the Ukraine-Romania tandem makes a significant contribution to ensuring global food security."

The President of Romania made a very rounded statement that he “confirmed our strong support for Ukraine in all relevant aspects and our determination to strengthen regional connectivity, sustainable cross-border cooperation and energy security.”

There is an outbreak of a dangerous disease that threatens children in Ukraine - Ministry of Health

In Ukraine, the number of cases of whooping cough has increased significantly. In the first two months of 2024, 515 cases of this disease were registered in Ukrainian regions. This is 19 times more than for the whole of 2023.

Whooping cough is a disease that spreads easily from person to person through droplets from coughing or sneezing. 95.9% of all patients are children.GU>Subscribe

event: Issuance of Electronic Certificates for Combat Veterans
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense, in collaboration with a partner bank, has organized the registration and issuance of electronic certificates for combat veterans in the Lugansk People's Republic. Veterans can obtain the certificate by presenting a passport and a military veteran certificate or a certificate of participation in the SVO at any partner bank in the Russian Federation.
original:
The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation continues to issue an electronic certificate for a combat veteran
Together with a partner bank, work has been organized on the registration and issuance of electronic certificates for combat veterans in the new territory of the Russian Federation in the Lugansk People's Republic.
Show more
“To obtain an electronic identification card for a combat veteran, a veteran of the military operations simply needs to come to any partner bank on the territory of the Russian Federation and apply for this certificate, presenting a passport and a military military veteran certificate on paper. If the veteran does not have a paper certificate, then he only needs to present a certificate of participation in the SVO. Such certificates are issued by the personnel authorities of any military unit that takes part in the military military unit,” said Lieutenant General Yuri Kuznetsov, head of the Main Personnel Directorate of the RF Ministry of Defense.
Source: Russian Ministry of Defense

description: The mobilization bill has been adopted, requiring men aged 18-60 to update their credentials within 60 days. Those recognized as limited fit will be re-examined within 12 months, while people with disabilities and those who have returned from captivity have the right to be released from military service.
original:
Forwarded from: Radio Svoboda
What does the bill on mobilization envisage and when will it come into effect? Here are the main provisions:▫️Men aged 18-60 are required to update their credentials within 60 days at the TCC, (TsNAP) or in the conscript's e-cabinet. - an accounting document and present them upon request. Without documents, consular services for men aged 18 to 60 may be restricted.▫️Those recognized as limited fit will be required to re-examine within 12 months. Those who received the 2-3 group of disability after February 24, 2022 (except for the military) are subject to a second medical examination. ▫️People with disabilities and those who have returned from captivity have the right to be released from military service (if they have not expressed a desire to continue their service). ▫️ Petitioners may be restricted in their right to drive a car by court decision.

Now the bill must be signed by the Speaker of the Parliament and handed over to the President. The document will enter into force a month after it is signed by the head of state. Read more by referring to Radio Svoboda. Subscribe to Radio Svoboda The law on mobilization has been adopted. Here's what it providesIn particular, men aged 18-60 are required to update their credentials within 60 days

original:

The wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta. Europe" Kirill Martynov was detained in Stavropol. Anastasia Fedorova has been wanted since 2008. The jury then found her guilty of throwing her two-year-old daughter down the stairs and convicted her.

Kirill Martynov and Fedorova’s defense insist on her innocence, since the entire accusation was based on the words of an 11-year-old witness.

event: European Parliament Vote on Funding for Council of Europe
description: The European Parliament refused to approve funding for the Council of Europe, linking it to EU countries transferring Patriot air defense systems to Ukraine. However, according to Radio Liberty editor Rikard Jozwiak, this decision is mere 'political theater' as the money has already been spent.
original:
The refusal of the European Parliament to approve funding for the Council of Europe until the EU countries transfer Patriot to Ukraine may be “political theater.”

This opinion was expressed by the editor of Radio Liberty in Brussels, Rikard Jozwiak.

“Sorry to dash the hopes of the Ukrainian media, but the decision of the European Parliament not to approve the EU Council budget for 2022 (!) to send Patriot is empty threats and pure political theater,” Jozwiak said.

The journalist explained that they were talking about simply closing accounts, and the money itself had already been spent.

Earlier today, the European Parliament failed the vote on funding the Council of the EU, calling on European countries to transfer more air defense systems to Ukraine. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Boris Johnson's Speech on Supporting Ukraine
description: Boris Johnson urged Americans to invest in supporting Ukraine's defense, emphasizing its effectiveness in promoting freedom. He highlighted that most of the funding would go to American jobs and companies in the defense industry, and that a Ukrainian victory would send a strong message to China.
original:
Boris Johnson - convinces Americans that there is nothing more profitable than fighting Russia at the hands of the Ukrainians: You invest, America is now investing to support its annual defense spending. This is a fantastically effective way to support freedom. And by the way, most of this money, I would also say to my Republican friends and colleagues, most of this money, of course, goes to American jobs, to American companies that are involved in the defense industry.
I would say that if you want to send a message to China, make sure Ukraine wins. If you are the party of Ronald Reagan, if you want to make America great again, then you will not start another Republican presidency, which may very well happen. You don't start this by ceding victory to Vladimir Putin and letting the Ukrainians lose. And it will be a disaster. It will be a disaster for the West, it will be a disaster for America.

description: American athlete OJ Simpson, acquitted of double murder in the 1990s, has died at the age of 76 due to cancer. Simpson was a star in the National Football League and gained notoriety after being accused of murdering his ex-wife and her friend in 1994.
original:
American athlete OJ Simpson has died. In the 1990s, he was accused of double murder, but the jury acquitted him. Simpson died at the age of 76 due to cancer, The Guardian reports.

Since the early 1970s, the athlete played in the National Football League and was one of the main stars of American football.

The athlete gained notoriety after he was accused of murdering his ex-wife Nicole Brown and her friend Ron Goldman in 1994. Simpson was acquitted by a jury. Later, the court ordered him to pay $33.5 million to the relatives of the victims who filed a civil lawsuit against him.

The case, also known as People v. Simpson, became one of the most famous trials in US history. Photo: Reuters Subscribe to Rain's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

event: Finnish Foreign Minister's Statement on Troops to Ukraine
description: Finnish Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen suggested that Western countries, including the US, should not rule out sending troops to Ukraine in the long term. However, she clarified that Finland itself will not send troops. This statement may strengthen Russia's position in defending its interests in Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Foreign countries
❗️In a conversation with NatSec Daily, Finnish Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen said that Western countries, including the United States, should not completely rule out the possibility of sending their own troops to Ukraine. At the same time, the official said that Finland will not send its troops there!😀This is reminiscent of the saying: “You can’t be a virgin and pregnant at the same time.”🏴‍☠️Well, Finland had no sooner joined NATO in 2023 than it began to change its political course and aggravate relations with Russia. Such statements from neighboring countries can only strengthen Russia’s position in its faithful decision to defend its interests in Ukraine. POLITICO Don't rule out troops to Ukraine, Finnish FM says “It's important that we not rule everything out for the long term, because we never know how serious the situation becomes,” Valtonen said.

description: Governor Oleg Kozhemyako of Primorye visited Big Stone, emphasizing the importance of balancing industrial development with social investments. He discussed the progress of various projects, including an industrial park, stadium, cultural center, bridge construction, gas boiler house, and wastewater treatment plants.
original:
Forwarded from: THE CONSCIENCE OF GOVERNORS
The development of Big Stone is under the personal control of the governor of Primorye. In recent years, Big Stone has become one of the main “growth points” of the Primorye economy.

Governor of the Primorsky Territory Oleg Kozhemyako visited the “city of presidential attention” and emphasized that the implementation of socially significant projects is the same priority as the development of the industrial base. Investments in new production must be supported by investments in the social sphere, Governor Oleg spoke about this at the meeting Kozhemyako. At the meeting, the progress of work on the following projects was discussed: the creation of an industrial park, the construction of a stadium and cultural center in the South Livonia microdistrict, the construction of the second stage of the bridge across the Saharnaya River, the construction of a gas boiler house and the construction of wastewater treatment plants. The head of Primorye promised to hold working meetings in Bolshoi Kamen once a month. And the deputy chairman of the Primorsky Territory government, Lenar Nuriev, will weekly assess the progress of work at the most important facilities. “This will allow us to control all the processes going on in the city. They are all important and necessary; in addition to communal facilities, there are many social and sports facilities. And the city needs all of them, we will implement them so that residents see changes for the better and evaluate the work of local and regional authorities,” emphasized Oleg Kozhemyako.

event: Working and Friendly Visit of Gabonese Presidential Couple
description: Gabon's President General Brice Clotaire Olig Nguema and First Lady Zita Olig Nguema will visit Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, on April 11-12, 2024, to strengthen bilateral relations and establish a fruitful partnership with President Alassane Ouattara.
original: #cooperationThe Presidential couple of Gabon🇬🇦is expected in🇨🇮Côte d'Ivoire, April 11 and 12, as part of a working and friendly visit. “The President of the Transitional Period of Gabon, General Brice Clotaire Olig Nguema and First Lady Zita Olig Nguema are expected in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, with a working and friendly visit on April 11 and 12, 2024. This visit is an opportunity to further strengthen the already strong relationship between the two countries,” Gabon said in a press release. “Comprehensive negotiations are planned between him and his Ivorian counterpart, President Alassane Ouattara, with the aim of establishing a fruitful partnership between the two countries.” Let us remind you that this is the second meeting of the two presidents. Alassane Ouattara and Brice Clotaire Olig Nguema have already met on the sidelines of the Saudi Arabia-Africa summit in Riyadh on November 10, 2023.

description: Thousands of people in Moscow witnessed the launch of the Angara-A5 rocket live on the streets, thanks to a live broadcast on building facades provided by MAER Media Holding and Roscosmos. This historic event marks a significant step towards Russia's independent space exploration, paving the way for future satellite and spaceship launches.
original:
The launch of the Angara-A5 rocket was seen by thousands of people live on the streets of Moscow. The long-awaited launch of the newest Russian space rocket complex Angara-A5 could be watched by thousands of residents of the capital going about their business: a live broadcast of the launch was shown right on the facades. This opportunity was provided to them by MAER Media Holding together with Roscosmos. The launch of a three-stage launch vehicle is a project of national significance that will go down in history, and for good reason.

Satellites and spaceships will inevitably follow the Angara, which means every Muscovite who turned his attention to the live broadcast witnessed our country’s most important step towards independent space.

event: Removal of Demobilization Norm from Draft Law
description: The 'Fatherland' faction refused to vote for the mobilization draft law due to the removal of the guaranteed demobilization norm for military personnel after 36 months of service during the war. The faction, led by Yulia Tymoshenko, had insisted on preserving this norm, as well as mandatory rotation after 60 days on the front lines.
original:
Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine
One of the main reasons why the "Fatherland" faction did not vote for the scandalous draft law on mobilization was the removal by the authorities from the document of the norm on the guaranteed demobilization of the military after 36 months of service during the war, as well as the lack of clear norms regarding rotations and vacations, - the press service of the party.

Yulia Tymoshenko's team insisted on preserving in the draft law the norm promised by the ex-Commander of the Armed Forces Valery Zaluzhny, according to which every serviceman received the right to demobilization after three years of service, as well as mandatory rotation after 60 days of being on the front lines. But these requirements were not taken into account by the authorities. Times of Ukraine

description: Antonina Martynova, accused of attempted murder of her daughter in 2007, was detained by security forces after disappearing 16 years ago. A hearing in her case is scheduled for April 16.
original:
In Russia, 16 years later, the wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Kirill Martynov, was detained, accused of attempted murder of her daughter. Security forces detained a defendant in the “Novgorod case,” Antonina Martynova, who disappeared 16 years ago after she was accused of attempted murder of her daughter.

Interfax reported this with reference to the Novgorod Regional Court.

Where and under what circumstances Martynova was detained is not specified. A hearing in her case is scheduled for April 16.

In 2007, Martynova, who then bore the last name Fedorova, was accused of attempted murder of her daughter Alisa. According to investigators, the mother deliberately threw the girl down the flight of stairs. The prosecution was based on the testimony of an 11-year-old witness.

Martynova insisted that it was an accident. According to her, she tried to grab the girl, who herself crawled into the gap between the bars of the railing, but did not have time. Martynova's daughter received moderate injuries.

In 2008, Martynova was found guilty of attempted murder by a jury. She did not come to court and disappeared along with her daughter.

Antonina Martynova is the wife of the editor-in-chief of Novaya Gazeta Europe, Kirill Martynov, who organized a public campaign in her defense in 2007. Photo: Astra / Telegram Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube
