original:
On the eve of Cosmonautics and Aviation Day at the Lugansk educational complex named after cosmonaut G.T. Beregovoy opened a modernized exhibition dedicated to the heroes of the Northern Military District
The exhibition is part of the educational project “Know! Remember! Be proud! and will be called “Faithful Sons of the Fatherland.” About it
Show more
said school director Natalya Nikishina. She also noted that, as part of the program for the development of school museums, the Foundation for Cultural Initiatives and the Victory Museum (Moscow) are helping school museums in new regions in equipping interactive exhibits, for which we are very grateful to them.
The museum will operate on a permanent basis (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/04/11/v-luganske-otkrylas-..).
“The museum contains our history, the history of the republic and its heroes. For the younger generation, such projects are very important and necessary,” the school detector emphasized.

description: Emergency services are conducting a rescue operation to evacuate a 54-year-old man, Maxim, from his apartment in Moscow. Eight rescuers are currently attempting to extract him, with additional forces en route to assist.
original:
Forwarded from: Emergency / Moscow
🤯They are trying to take a 400-kilogram man, who became ill, out of an apartment in Moscow.

For the last three years he has not been able to walk due to the consequences of Covid, and in total he has not left the house for 10 years. The father was looked after by his 24-year-old son all this time.

Eight rescuers cannot get him out of his home and are waiting for additional forces to help.

According to SHOT, emergency services are now cutting bars from the windows of a house on Malaya Kalitnikovskaya Street and have installed fire escapes to pull 54-year-old Maxim out of his apartment. A man complained of severe pain in his heart in the morning and called an ambulance. Emergency / Moscow

event: Kim Jong-un Calls for War Preparation

description: A photo exhibition titled 'Russia from a Bird's Eye View' has opened in the 'My Russia' ethnopark in Sochi, featuring 26 photographs showcasing Russia's expanses from a unique angle. The exhibition presents works from the Russian Geographical Society's annual photo competition, highlighting the country's wildlife and environment.
original:
Wow! My photo of the "Genoese Fortress" at the exhibition in Sochi. Subscriber Inessa just sent a photo from there.

A photo exhibition “Russia from a Bird's Eye View” has opened in the “My Russia” ethnopark - 26 photographs allow you to look at the expanses of our homeland from a special angle.

The exhibition presents photographs of participants in the annual photo competition of the Russian Geographical Society “The Most Beautiful Country”, dedicated to the preservation of Russian wildlife and education of respect for the environment.

At the exhibition you can see the White Rocks of Iturup, the Tolbukhin lighthouse - one of the oldest signal structures in Russia, be amazed at the Adyghe “dragon” - the Karamuruntau ridge, and the majestic walls of the Genoese fortress in the Republic of Crimea.

To love and admire are the same root words. At the exhibition “Bird's Eye View of Russia” these feelings follow each other from photograph to photograph.

We invite you to the “My Russia” ethnopark to admire the unique works of photographers and admire the beauty of Russian open spaces! The exhibition is located near the Kazan pavilion on the embankment of the Mzymta River, and can be visited during park opening hours from 10:00 to 20:00.

event: Opening of Memorial to Civilians of USSR - Victims of Nazi Genocide
description: On the 80th anniversary of Leningrad's liberation from the fascist blockade, a memorial was opened in the Gatchina district of the Leningrad region to honor the civilians of the USSR who were victims of the Nazi genocide. President Vladimir Putin spoke at the opening, condemning the systemic punitive actions that led to mass murders of unarmed civilians.
original:
Today is the International Day of the Liberation of Prisoners of Nazi Camps.
Death camps, ghettos and other places of forced detention created by the German Nazis and their allies are one of the most terrible, inhuman pages of world history. Nazi camps were created wherever a fascist set foot.
Show more
This year, on the day of the 80th anniversary of the complete liberation of Leningrad from the fascist blockade, a Memorial to the civilians of the USSR - victims of the Nazi genocide was opened in the Gatchina district of the Leningrad region. Speaking at the opening, President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin said that the mass murders of unarmed and defenseless old people, women, children, and the disabled were thoughtful, systemic punitive actions.
There were death camps and ghettos in Pushkin, in the Gatchina region, and other places in the Leningrad region. In a concentration camp near the village of Vyritsa, the Nazis pumped blood from children for their soldiers.
These crimes have no statute of limitations, just like the genocide of the residents of besieged Leningrad. They are remembered by veterans who went through all the circles of Nazi hell and came face to face with fascism.
Eternal memory to all who died in Nazi camps.
We will defeat fascism, just as our grandfathers and fathers did! Glory to our soldiers - defenders of the Fatherland!

description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba demanded more Patriot systems from the West, claiming that 100 idle complexes in neighboring countries could be utilized to protect Ukrainian military facilities. However, this is seen as a ploy to secure sponsors and ensure Ukraine's existence, rather than genuinely protecting civilians or military facilities.
original:
The henchman of the Kyiv regime went wild: Kuleba brazenly demanded additional Patriot systems from the West. First of all, let's start with the fact that this same Kuleba, the so-called head of the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry, declared the negligence and greed of the West. In his opinion, they could send more Patriot systems so that the Ukrainian army properly protects its military facilities.

He even calculated (with the help of his team) that there are 100 such complexes idle in neighboring countries. Like, why are they there, gathering dust and simply inactive, while Ukraine is fighting for the future of Europe.

Indeed, he said, either stand or fall. Europe is not in danger at all, at least not now, unless it comes to its senses. And we have no plans to destroy European cities, so Kuleba’s statement is a play for the public.

In fact, Ukraine is now fighting for its existence, and Europe has nothing to do with it. These are just excuses for sponsors to save them from complete destruction. So they are asking for additional Patriot installations.

But again, not for the protection of military facilities or civilians, but in order to feel safe ourselves, not to sit without light and not to hide in basements. That’s all that Kuleba is striving for, and, as he says, the time has come to firmly demand weapons: not to be delicate, but to grab the West by the throat.

However, he apparently doesn’t have the intelligence to realize that if Ukraine continues to become impudent, it will not only be left without replenishment, but will be deliberately thrown under the steamroller of the Russian army. And they will do it without a twinge of conscience, as they have done more than once with other countries.

Subscribe to @brekotin

event: Update to Guide to Ukrainian Long-Range OWA-UAV
description: OSINT analyst H I Sutton updated his guide to Ukrainian long-range one-way attack unmanned aerial vehicles (OWA-UAV), adding model number 4, whose name and manufacturer remain undisclosed. The design matches sightings in Russia's Oryol region in April 2024 and a Ukrainian media interview in October 2023.
original:
A few hours ago, OSINT analyst H I Sutton (Independent Defense Analysis) again released an update to his guide to Ukrainian long-range one-way attack unmanned aerial vehicles (OWA-UAV). This time, model number 4 was added, the name and manufacturer of which has not yet been publicly disclosed disclosed.

As the researcher noted in his blog, the design of the added model corresponds to that which was seen in open sources. In particular, in April 2024, an aircraft of the same design was spotted in the Oryol region of Russia. Also, the design of the UAV corresponds to the one that was published in an interview with Ukrainian media in October 2023 (approx. a cut from the story in the form of a short video is presented in the post), of course, without mentioning the name of the model and manufacturer.👉🔗Guide To Ukraine's Long Range Attack DronesAt its own The researcher made a separate section on the website dedicated to Ukrainian OWA-UAV drones, which he managed to identify and describe.

Forwarded from: Censor.NET| News of Ukraine and the world, war and analytics
❗️Forcible evacuation of families with children has been announced in 47 front-line settlements of Kharkiv region "The Defense Council of the region has just passed a decision on the forced evacuation of families with children in 47 front-line settlements", - said the head of OVA Oleg Sinegubov.

We are talking only about settlements close to the border with the Russian Federation of Kharkiv, Bogodukhiv and Izyum districts.

According to the OVA, 182 children live in the designated settlements.

"This decision does not apply to the city of Kharkiv. Evacuation routes have already been determined and people's places of temporary residence have been booked," Synegubov added.@censor_net|We are on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tik-Tok, SL8

event: Deployment of Afrika Corps in Niger
description: Following the success of the Afrika Corps deployment in Burkina Faso, Niger has agreed in principle to host the Russian military unit. The decision was made during a Russian delegation visit to Niamey, led by Deputy Minister of Defense Yunus-Bek Evkurov, who also met with leaders in Mali and Burkina Faso.
original:
After Burkina Faso, the Afrika Corps will appear in Niger, reports Afrique Media.
An agreement in principle on this was reached during the visit of the Russian delegation to Niamey on December 4 last year. The negotiations were attended by the Minister of Defense of Niger, Salif Modi, and the Deputy Minister of Defense, Yunus-Bek Evkurov.
Before Niger, Evkurov visited Mali and Burkina Faso, where he met with Assimi Goitoi and Ibrahim Traoré. “The Niger authorities decided to follow the example of Burkina Faso, where the recent deployment of the Afrika Korps has already yielded significant results in the field of security,” the publication shares inside information. #niger#Russians_in_Africa# SahelAfrique MédiaAprès le Burkina Faso, l'Africa Corps russe sera déployé au Niger - Afrique MédiaLe Niger, qui a rompu ses relations avec la France et dénoncé les accords militaires avec les États-Unis, entend renforcer

description: The University Clinical Center of the Republika Srpska and the Research Center for Surgery, Transplantology and Hematology from Minsk signed a cooperation agreement, enabling patients from Republika Srpska to receive treatment in Belarus, particularly for kidney and other organ transplants.
location: Banja Luka, Republika Srpska, Bosnia and Herzegovina
original:
Forwarded from: About Serbia in Russian
Patients from the Republika Srpska will go for treatment to Belarus. The director of the University Clinical Center of the Republika Srpska, Vlado Dzhajic, and the director of the Research Center for Surgery, Transplantology and Hematology from Minsk, Oleg Rumo, signed a cooperation agreement today. - This is very good news for our patients awaiting transplantation, especially the kidneys, but also other organs,” said Dzhajic. According to the director of the UCC RS, an agreement has been reached to increase the number of MS patients operated on in Belarus. “The next important step will be to study what opportunities there are for pre- and postoperative examinations at the UCC “to provide patients with the opportunity to quickly travel to Belarus for treatment,” said Vlado Dzhajic.@ruserbia– About Serbia in Russian

description: Embraer introduced a new modification of the C-390 Millenium military transport aircraft, designed for maritime patrol, at FIDAE 2024 in Chile. The S-390 MPA is equipped with a radar and anti-ship missiles, and is being developed in collaboration with the Brazilian Air Force for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance missions.
original:
Embraer introduced a new modification of the C390Brazilianbq manufacturer continues to dominate the news feed from the FIDAE 2024 exhibition in Chile. This time, the Brazilians presented a completely new modification of their C-390 Millenium military transport aircraft, designed for maritime patrol.

As part of FIDAE 2024, Embraer said it was conducting “collaborative studies” with the Brazilian Air Force to explore and “identify potential adaptations of the platform for intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance [ISR] missions.” Despite the fact that the statement does not indicate a specific type of aircraft, the published render shows the C-390 Millenium.

The aircraft shown in the rendering was named S-390 MPA. It is equipped with a radar mounted under the forward fuselage and carries a pair of anti-ship missiles on hardpoints under the wing.

“The joint research will expand the portfolio of solutions to meet the operational needs of the ISR missions of the Brazilian Air Force and potential international customers,” said Embraer Defense & Security Executive Director Bosco da Costa Junior.@AviaNews

event: Presentation of Financial Literacy Development Project
description: The Automobile and Highway Institute of Donetsk National Technical University in Gorlovka presented a financial literacy development project, 'Simply pro finance', for demobilized students and teachers. The event was attended by employees, students, and local administration officials.
original:
A project for the development of financial literacy was presented at the Automobile and Highway Institute (branch) of Donetsk National Technical University in Gorlovka

On Wednesday, April 10, at the Automobile and Highway Institute (branch) of Donetsk National Technical University in Gorlovka, a financial literacy development project “Simply pro finance” was presented for demobilized students and teachers. The event was attended by employees and students, as well as the head of the youth policy department of the Gorlovka city district administration, Daria Lozovaya, and the head of the culture department of the Gorlovka city district administration, Nelya Korotkova.
 
The project is being implemented by the institute as part of a grant competition of the Association for the Development of Financial Literacy.

The team of the Automobile and Highway Institute (branch) of Donetsk National Technical University of Gorlovka thanks the administration of the Gorlovka urban district of the Donetsk People's Republic for their support and assistance in organizing the project.@Gorlowka_now

event: Fundraising for Vehicle for Air Defense Forces
description: A fundraising campaign is underway to purchase a vehicle for the 1039 anti-aircraft missile regiment, 8 anti-aircraft missile platoon, military unit A1964. The vehicle is crucial for the air defense unit's mobility and effectiveness in combat tasks. Donations are being sought to support the Ukrainian Defenders in protecting the sky.
original:
URGENT RECRUITMENT FOR A VEHICLE for SOLDIERS of Air Defense Forces-1039 anti-aircraft missile regiment 8 anti-aircraft missile platoon, military unit A1964.

description: On April 11, 1944, the Red Army, with the help of local residents, defeated Nazi troops and liberated the Arabat Strelka, Schastlivtsevo, and the important railway junction in Chongar, completely freeing the Kherson region from German occupation.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
Exactly 80 years ago, the Red Army knocked out the last German invaders from the lands of the Kherson region. On April 11, 1944, Soviet soldiers, with the selfless help of local residents, defeated the Nazi troops and liberated the Arabat Strelka and Schastlivtsevo. The next day, an important railway junction in Chongar was recaptured from the Nazis. The territory of the Kherson region within its modern borders was completely liberated from the invaders.

Before this, the Genichesk region was under German occupation for almost three years. And although a significant part of its inhabitants was forced to hide or flee, many of the Genic residents played an important role in the liberation of their native land in April 1944.

Today, 80 years later, when we are forced to once again fight the fascist scourge, it is especially important to remember the exploits of the Great Patriotic War in order to worthily continue the work of our victorious ancestors.@SALDO_VGA

Since 2014, the number of cases has increased from 2% to almost 20%. This trend is attributed to the reluctance of girls to change multiple documents.
original:
👰 ♀️Today, there is a trend when girls, when getting married, leave their last name.

The Minister of Justice of the Republic of Kazakhstan Oleg Shapovalov spoke about this in an interview with Krymskaya Gazeta.

“If earlier, when women got married, they were required to take their husband’s surname, but today we are moving away from this. Since 2014, we have seen that cases where girls leave their last name when getting married have increased from 2% to almost 20%,” says Shapovalov.

He noted that this trend is observed due to the reluctance of girls to change a large number of documents. But husbands, according to him, very rarely take their wife’s surname.

event: Detonation of Grenades at Village Council Meeting
description: On December 15, 2023, a terrorist deputy detonated three RGD-5 and F-1 combat fragmentation grenades during a meeting of the Keretsk Village Council in Transcarpathia, injuring 26 citizens, including himself, and killing two. The perpetrator aimed to influence decision-making on personnel and budget issues.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The Security Service of Ukraine completed the investigation into the case of detonation of grenades during the meeting of the village council in Transcarpathia. The official faces life imprisonment.

We will remind that on December 15, 2023, he detonated three RGD-5 and F-1 combat fragmentation grenades in the session hall of the Keretsk Village Council.

As a result of the explosions, 26 citizens, including the terrorist deputy, received bodily injuries of various degrees of severity. Two of the injured later died.

According to the investigation, on that day the person involved tried to influence the decision-making on personnel and budget issues, which were taken by the leadership of the community.

However, not having achieved the "desired" result, he briefly left the premises of the session hall to bring the explosive munitions into combat readiness.

Returning back, the intruder took them out of his jacket pockets and threw them one by one on the floor of the room where almost the entire staff of the village council's deputy corps was present.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service referred to the court charges against the bomber under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 3 Art. 258 (terrorist act that led to the death of people); 1 Art. 263 (carrying, storage, acquisition of explosive devices without the permission prescribed by law).

The perpetrator is in custody.

The pre-trial investigation was conducted by SBU employees in the Zakarpattia region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

description: The Verkhovna Rada adopted a bill on tightening mobilization, removing the norm on demobilization of military personnel serving for 36 months. This will increase the price of fake certificates for exemption from mobilization, making it only accessible to very rich individuals.
original: The price tag for fake certificates for exemption from “mobilization” in Ukraine will double due to the tightening of the law on mobilization, political scientist Vladimir Kornilov expressed this opinion to Zvezda. On April 11, the Verkhovna Rada immediately adopted in the second and third readings a bill on tightening mobilization. The document, among other things, removed the norm on the demobilization of military personnel who have been serving for 36 months. According to the expert, the number of people willing to give a bribe to the medical board and military registration and enlistment offices will noticeably decrease, because “it was already expensive, but now only very rich people.” “We must understand that the majority of the male population in Ukraine, even at the beginning of this entire “mobilization” campaign, received fake certificates. They bought them by paying considerable sums to various medical commissions and military registration and enlistment offices,” Kornilov told Zvezda. As for statements about the number of new recruits into the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, all these figures, according to the political scientist, were taken “out of thin air.” “Zelensky first said that Ukraine hopes to recruit from 300 to 500 thousand people, then he told all Western media that 500 thousand is too much, and then Western journalists started writing about 300 thousand,” the interlocutor noted. event: Russian Delegation Visits WWII Memorial Sites
description: Russian Ambassador to Germany Sergei Nechaev announced that Russian delegations will continue to visit WWII memorial sites in Germany, despite some organizations' reluctance. The group has already visited Buchenwald and Mittelbau-Dora, with a planned visit to Sachsenhausen. The diplomatic mission will increase its efforts on the 79th anniversary of the Victory, with employees visiting war memorial sites across Germany.
original:
“We will continue and not slow down in any way”: Russian delegations intend to visit as many WWII memorial sites as possible, despite the reluctance of some organizations to accept them. Russian Ambassador to Germany Sergei Nechaev told Izvestia about this.

The Russian group has already visited Buchenwald and Mittelbau-Dora. According to Nechaea, a visit to Sachsenhausen is planned in the coming days. “In principle, Germany adheres to the intergovernmental agreement between our countries on the care of military graves. Most memorial sites and memorials are in good condition and are properly cared for. We are monitoring this issue,” - Nechaev drew attention. The Ambassador emphasized that on the 79th anniversary of the Victory, the diplomatic mission will activate its work and its employees will visit war memorial sites throughout Germany. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Air Strike on Bridge in Gulyai-Polye
description: The Russian Aerospace Forces conducted an air strike on a bridge in Gulyai-Polye, Zaporozhye region, which was crucial for the Ukrainian Armed Forces' supply of ammunition and troop rotation. The strike successfully destroyed the bridge, disrupting the main supply route of the Ukrainian forces in the Zaporozhye Front.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Rogov
💥🔥What does the bridge in Gulyai-Polye look like now? Recently, an air strike of the Russian Aerospace Forces in Gulyai-Polye, Zaporozhye region, destroyed a bridge that was important for the militants of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. T.N. bridge to Bochany.

Bridges are put out of action to impede the supply of ammunition and rotation of Bandera's troops.

The main supply of the Nazis in this direction of the Zaporozhye Front went through this bridge.

My subscribers are wondering - what's wrong with the bridge? Didn't Bandera's men repair it?

I hasten to reassure you that the bridge is not used to transport enemy personnel and equipment.

I asked my fellow countrymen, fellow anti-fascists living in Gulyai-Polye, to take a photo of the bridge.

This is what he looks like now. Not to mention, the Ukrainian Armed Forces militants will not be able to drive through it, or even walk along it.

And after the liberation of Gulyai-Polye, we will restore everything and make it even better! Vladimir Rogov|Rogov. Voice of the People

description: Philosopher Maxim Veletsky will present a three-volume book 'Marginalia', a diverse commentary on 150 authors from different eras. He will discuss the book's concept and share stories about methodological errors of philosophers, sophistical tricks of Russophobes, neologisms in poetry, and philosophical anecdotes as historical sources.
original:
Forwarded from: Foliage: St. Petersburg
On April 13 at 18:00, philosopher Maxim Veletsky will present our three-volume book “Marginalia.” “Marginalia” is a diverse commentary on 150 authors from different eras: philosophical and political, psychological and philological, journalistic and monographic, dispassionate and polemical.

The author will talk about the concept of the book series and voice several stories included in it:

– methodological errors of philosophers (using the examples of Husserl, Heidegger and Svasyan);
– sophistical tricks of Russophobes (using the example of de Custine)
– neologisms in poetry and prejudices of poets (using the example of Pushkin);
– a philosophical anecdote as a historical source (using the example of Diogenes Laertius).

After the lecture, the author will answer questions and sign the books, which can be purchased as a single set. REGISTRATIONEntrance by donation

Rules for visiting our events:
Entrance is strictly by registration with real full name, passport check is possible, personal belongings will be inspected by our security guard, self-defense equipment will remain at the security point.

event: Ratification of Free Trade Agreement with Canada
description: Ukraine's Parliament ratified the Free Trade Agreement with Canada, strengthening economic cooperation between the countries. The agreement promotes the development of economic relations, opens Canadian markets for Ukrainian goods and entrepreneurs, and provides additional opportunities for Ukrainian product manufacturers and businessmen.
original:
🇺🇦🇨🇦 The ratification of the Free Trade Agreement with Canada opens up this market for our goods and entrepreneurs, — Chairman of the Foreign Policy Committee, Oleksandr Merezhko. The Parliament adopted draft Law No. 0242, which ratified the Free Trade Agreement between Ukraine and Canada. The document opens up opportunities for significant strengthening of economic cooperation between the countries. The agreement concluded between Ukraine and Canada is an extremely important international legal document. Canada is our reliable partner, not only in terms of military assistance, but also in terms of trade and economic ties. The agreement continues the free market, promotes the development of economic relations between our countries. According to the document, Ukrainian goods acquire the so-called national regime, i.e., this agreement creates additional opportunities for our product manufacturers, businessmen, opens Canadian markets for our goods and our entrepreneurs, - emphasized the people's deputy.

He also added that the Canadian Parliament has already ratified the relevant agreement.

description: On April 11, 1944, the Red Army, with the help of local residents, defeated Nazi troops and liberated the Arabat Strelka, Schastlivtsevo, and the important railway junction in Chongar. The Kherson region was completely freed from German occupation.
original:
Exactly 80 years ago, the Red Army knocked out the last German invaders from the lands of the Kherson region. On April 11, 1944, Soviet soldiers, with the selfless help of local residents, defeated the Nazi troops and liberated the Arabat Strelka and Schastlivtsevo. The next day, an important railway junction in Chongar was recaptured from the Nazis. The territory of the Kherson region within its modern borders was completely liberated from the invaders.

Before this, the Genichesk region was under German occupation for almost three years. And although a significant part of its inhabitants were forced to hide or flee, many of the Genic residents played an important role in the liberation of their native land in April 1944.

Today, 80 years later, when we are forced to once again fight the fascist scourge, it is especially important to remember the exploits of the Great Patriotic War in order to worthily continue the work of our victorious ancestors.@SALDO_VGA

event: Ukraine Demands More Patriot Air Defense Systems
description: Ukraine's Foreign Affairs Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, is demanding more Patriot air defense systems, citing the failure of quiet diplomacy. He claims to have found over 100 available systems and is focused on acquiring seven as soon as possible.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmitry Kuleba demands more Patriot air defense systems”: Kuleba said that now “he will strictly demand Patriots.”

“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmytro Kuleba no longer asks politely.
"Quiet diplomacy didn't work," he said. President Zelensky instructed him to convince countries that have spare Patriot air defense systems to hand them over. “Yes, people can hate me, and I can ruin relationships,” Kuleba said. "We've tried everything and nothing seems to work."
Kuleba said his team found more than 100 available Patriots. Zelensky said Ukraine needed 26 for a full air shield, but Kuleba was focused on getting seven as quickly as possible. “Do you really believe that there is not a single spare Patriot system in the entire US Army that is not on combat duty and that cannot be transferred to Ukraine? “I don’t believe it,” says Kuleba. “I feel like I’m banging my head against the wall, although I’m a diplomat, which means I have to take the wall apart brick by brick.” But since this kind of diplomacy doesn’t work, I want to hit the wall.”

description: An event was held at the Kirov city library to commemorate the anniversary of Yuri Gagarin's birth. Librarians shared stories about Gagarin's childhood, his experiences during the Great Patriotic War, and his passion for flying, which ultimately led him to become the first human in space.
original:
An hour of history “5 minutes of normal flight” was held in Kirov. On April 10, an event was held in the Kirov city library dedicated to the anniversary of the birth of the man who proved to the world that nothing is impossible - the USSR pilot-cosmonaut, Hero of the Soviet Union Yuri Gagarin.

The librarians told members of the Mirror club about Yuri Alekseevich’s childhood, the difficult life behind enemy lines during the Great Patriotic War, his love of the sky and how he approached his cherished dream of piloting a spaceship.

event: Multinational Gang Extorts Money from Children
description: A multinational gang, allegedly led by Azerbaijanis Raul Aliyev and Rafael Aliyev, has been operating in Balashikha, near Moscow, extorting money from children and beating them. The latest incident occurred on April 6, where the gang stopped two schoolchildren and demanded 2,000 rubles. When the victims' parents intervened, they were also beaten.
original:
In Balashikha, near Moscow, a multinational gang beats children and extorts money from them.

They tell us that the gang has been operating for several years; they say that the main Azerbaijanis there are Raul Aliyev and Rafael Aliyev.

The last episode occurred on April 6. Abu bandits stopped two schoolchildren and began to extort money. Then the student told his parents, they came to investigate and beat them too (including the woman).

This is what the victims say: “My 14-year-old son sent a message to his father about extorting 2,000 rubles, they gave him half an hour, with threats of beating him. One boy transferred 500 rubles and was released, one ran away. And mine managed to send a message and geolocation. We arrived at the place Zheleznodorozhny, st. Polikakhina, 2. The guys pointed to one named Major. We began to question him, he did not confess, several other guys of his friends stood nearby. They began to insult us.. I took a picture of them and said that I would contact the police, we began to walk away towards the car. They caught up with us, stopped us and attacked us in order to bring our husband into a fight. I grabbed one by the T-shirt and asked him to stop. For which he beat me, then my husband.” Judging by what we are told and the comments, this gang has really been operating for a long time, the local police officer is aware of it, but does nothing.

description: Timur Utkin, with the call sign Moskvich, was killed on March 30 during an assault on a Ukrainian Armed Forces stronghold in Krasnogorovka, Donetsk direction. He was remembered by his comrades as a kind, positive, and sympathetic person who always volunteered for combat missions, motivated by a desire to defend his homeland, the Russian Federation.
original:
Forwarded from: ANNA NEWS
"Hero of our time".

This is exactly what colleagues say about the recently deceased Timur Utkin with the call sign Moskvich.

He was killed on March 30 during the assault on an important stronghold of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Krasnogorovka in the Donetsk direction.

“He was a kind, positive, sympathetic guy. He was always one of the first to raise his hand and follow the guys on a combat mission. I call such people: “heroes of our time,” because he left Moscow, from the warm place in which he was. He came to us, to our republic, to protect not only us, children, and the elderly. But, as he always said: “I came here to defend my homeland, the Russian Federation.” God bless Timur’s parents with health and patience. Thank them for raising such a son, a real man and warrior,” his comrade said about the young guy.

Shortly before Timur's death, military correspondent @anna_newsDaniil Piontkovsky recorded an interview with him.@anna_news

event: Attack on Trypil Thermal Power Station
description: The Russian Federation launched a successful attack on the Trypil thermal power station using Kh-69 cruise missiles, which were able to pass through Ukrainian air defense. The missiles, launched from tactical aircraft, have a range of approximately 400 km, making them a significant threat to Ukraine's territory.
original:
❗️the Russian Federation used Kh-69 missiles to strike the Trypil thermal power station and it is more dangerous than "Dagger" — Defense Express

The Kh-69 is a subsonic cruise missile for tactical aircraft that the enemy can use with the Su-34 and Su-35.

During the attack on the Trypil TPP, the enemy used its new Kh-69 cruise missiles, which allowed it to completely destroy the most powerful power plant in the Kyiv region. This is indicated by the found fragments of this missile, which Defense Express learned from its own sources.
At the same time, according to the received additional information, the launch range of the missiles was about 400 km. This parameter exceeds the known estimates of the X-69 range of 300 km, as the next iteration of the X-59MK2.

Why is this bad for us? First, a successful strike indicates that the missile can pass through exhausted Ukrainian air defense. Second, due to the launch of the missile from the sides of tactical aircraft, the typical sign of large-scale attacks with the takeoff of MiG-31k or Tu-95/Tu-160. ▪️Thirdly, if the production of these missiles is established, then due to the large number of carriers, their use can be mass-scale.

The good news is that the production of these missiles is not serial yet and there is no question of their stocks.

The missile's range of 400 km is sufficient to hit most objects on the territory of Ukraine, and if we take into account the possibility of launching from the territory of the Republic of Belarus, then the west of Ukraine is also not protected from these missiles (see the last picture).

description: Vietnamese businesswoman Truong My Lan was sentenced to death for fraud, accused of embezzling over $12 billion through shell companies and bribes to high-ranking officials. The total damage is estimated at $22 billion.
original:
One of Vietnam's richest businesswomen was sentenced to death for fraud. The court decided that she stole $12 billion - that's 3% of the country's annual GDP. 67-year-old Truong My Lan is one of Vietnam's most famous entrepreneurs. She started her career selling cosmetics at the central market in Ho Chi Minh City. When communist Vietnam launched market reforms in the late 1980s, it moved into land and real estate transactions. Many of Vietnam’s richest people made a fortune from this in those years, notes the BBC.

In 2012, Truong My Lan gained control of the Saigon Commercial Bank, which soon became the largest private lender in Vietnam by assets.

Vietnamese law does not allow one person to own more than 5% of the shares of any bank, but Truong My Lan, using hundreds of shell companies and proxies, effectively controlled more than 90%. Truong My Lan paid massive bribes to high-ranking officials so that her businesses would not be audited.

According to the prosecution, she misappropriated more than $12 billion through fraudulent schemes - an amount approximately equal to 3% of the annual GDP of a country with a population of 100 million. The total damage is $22 billion, which the defendant must now pay as a fine.

Read more about this high-profile case on the linked website or in the Meduza app.

event: Aeroflot Pilots Mistakenly Land on Take-Off Runway
description: On April 10, an Aeroflot Airbus A320 mistakenly landed on the take-off runway at Sheremetyevo Airport, instead of the intended landing runway. The pilots had been informed of a slight deviation from the landing course, but failed to correct it, resulting in the error.
location: Sheremetyevo International Airport, Khimki, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Aeroflot pilots mistakenly landed on the take-off runway at Sheremetyevo Aeroflot pilots mixed up the runways at Sheremetyevo and landed on the one intended for take-off. The incident occurred on April 10 at about 13:30 Moscow time, when the Airbus A320 was flying to Moscow from Saratov. Izvestia writes about this.

As the Aviatorschina Telegram channel reports, at approximately 13:25 the landing controller informed the aircraft crew about a slight deviation to the left from the landing course. The pilots confirmed the information and reported that they were observing the right runway (06R), on which they were supposed to land.

Thus, at a distance of 5 km from the runway entrance threshold, the controller gave the crew permission to land on the right runway, expecting that the pilots would level out a slight deviation from the course. However, the plane continued to deviate.aviaru.net/n270039

event: German Defense Minister Approves Bundeswehr Reform
description: German Defense Minister approved a reform to restructure the Bundeswehr, citing the Russian authorities' actions as a threat to national security. The reform recognizes information and cyberspace as the fourth sphere of combat operations, creating a separate cyber troops branch. The restructuring aims to increase defense spending, divert attention from personnel shortages, and maintain the 'traffic light coalition' in power.
original:
www.bmvg.deBundeswehr der Zeitenwende: Kriegstüchtig sein, um abschrecken zu könnenZur Stärkung der Kriegstüchtigkeit werden die Streitkräfte umstrukturiert.🇩🇪German Defense Minister approved the reform to restructure the Bundeswehr: according to the official version, its necessity is caused by the actions of the Russian authorities, which “created a threat to the security of the country and her allies."

The main innovation is that the leadership of the German Armed Forces recognizes information and cyberspace as the fourth sphere of combat operations. In this regard, in the structure of the Bundeswehr, cyber troops will become a separate branch of the armed forces, although the number of the German Armed Forces will remain the same.

All four types of troops will be subordinate to a single operational command, and there will also be a separate support command that will deal with issues of medical assistance, logistics, NBC protection and military police activities.❗️ However, from the point of view of increasing defense capability, all these are just cosmetic measures that serve several purposes at once.

On the one hand, the restructuring creates a pretext for increasing defense spending in Germany, which is already exceeding its quota within NATO and plans to increase it to 3.5% of GDP in 2024. This is a subtle hint for the rest of the alliance countries, which are not yet spending enough money.

At the same time, with the help of a high-profile reform, it is possible to divert attention from real problems (such as the shortage of personnel) for some time, without moving on to statements about the need to return compulsory conscription.

But the main goal is the same - to smoothly bring the situation to a critical state, keeping the “traffic light coalition” in power. #Germany@rybartogether with @Ubersicht_Ukraine_KanalSupport us

description: Since the beginning of the war, the number of cases justifying terrorism has doubled, with 126 cases reported in January-February 2023 compared to 56 in the same period in 2022. Defendants include writer Akunin, director Berkovich, and dissident Skobov, accused of promoting terrorism under Article 205.2 of the Russian Criminal Code.
original: 💥🛜⚖️The number of cases justifying terrorism has doubled since the beginning of the war. The defendants in these cases are not Hamas apologists, but the writer Akunin, director Berkovich, dissident Skobov. Russians are increasingly accused of justifying and promoting terrorism (Article 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation), as follows from the statistics of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The number of cases increased from 56 to 126 compared to January-February 2022. In statistics, there is no division into parts of the article: part 1 threatens with imprisonment for up to 5 years, part 2 - justification of terrorism in the media and the Internet - from 5 to 7 years. Cases of justification of terrorism are considered by military courts behind closed doors, and the investigation is conducted by the FSB . Among the reasons for initiating such cases: comments about the attack on the Crimean Bridge (as in the case of the recently arrested Alexander Skobov), about the murder of Daria Dugina and z-blogger Vladlen Tatarsky; Lately there have been posts about the terrorist attack in Crocus. Writer Boris Akunin, sociologist Boris Kagarlitsky and Skobov are charged with the more serious second part. Sometimes the courts are limited to a fine, but the sentences are becoming more and more cruel: Kagarlitsky’s fine, which had already been paid by that time, was replaced on appeal by 5 years in prison. Director Evgenia Berkovich, playwright Svetlana Petriychuki, left-wing activist Sergei Udaltsov are in pre-trial detention. Akunin, human rights activist Vladimir Osechkin, actor Alexey Panin, feminist Zalina Marshenkulova, Sota editor Anna Loiko, who are also accused under this article, live abroad and are inaccessible to the Russian court.📌Any public statement can be considered a justification for terrorism - anti-war activists and just random people are often accused of it.👉Under the article those who justify the terrorist practices of radical Islamists do not fail. event: Ukraine Demands More Patriot Air Defense Systems
description: Ukraine's Foreign Affairs Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, is demanding more Patriot air defense systems, citing the failure of quiet diplomacy. He claims to have found over 100 available systems and is focused on acquiring seven as soon as possible.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmitry Kuleba demands more Patriot air defense systems”: Kuleba said that now “he will strictly demand Patriots.”

“Minister of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine Dmytro Kuleba no longer asks politely.
"Quiet diplomacy didn't work," he said. President Zelensky instructed him to convince countries that have spare Patriot air defense systems to hand them over. “Yes, people can hate me, and I can ruin relationships,” Kuleba said. "We've tried everything and nothing seems to work."
Kuleba said his team found more than 100 available Patriots. Zelensky said Ukraine needed 26 for a full air shield, but Kuleba was focused on getting seven as quickly as possible. “Do you really believe that there is not a single spare Patriot system in the entire US Army that is not on combat duty and that cannot be transferred to Ukraine? “I don’t believe it,” says Kuleba. “I feel like I’m banging my head against the wall, although I’m a diplomat, which means I have to take the wall apart brick by brick.” But since this kind of diplomacy doesn’t work, I want to hit the wall.”

event: Air Defense Against Combined Air Strike
description: Ukraine's air defense forces, in cooperation with other defense components, successfully repelled a combined air strike by destroying 57 air targets, including 16 cruise missiles and 39 attack UAVs. Despite their efforts, civilian infrastructure was hit.
original:
57 air targets were destroyed: 18 out of 42 missiles and 39 out of 40 Shaheds. At night, the enemy launched a combined air strike with missiles of various types and attack UAVs.

In total, the enemy used 82 means of air attack: 20 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles; 6 Kh-47M2 "Kinzhal" aeroballistic missiles; 12 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles; 40 "Shahed-131/136" type attack UAVs; 4 guided air missiles Kh-59.

The forces and means of air defense of the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in cooperation with the air defense of other components of the Defense Forces destroyed 57 air targets: 16 cruise missiles Kh-101/Kh-555; 39 strike UAVs of the "Shahed-131/136" type; 2 guided air missiles Kh- 59.

Despite the professional and conscientious work of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, which repelled the air attack, unfortunately there are hits on civilian infrastructure.

description: The North Korean ATGM Bulsae-5 is an example of a successful weapon being cloned in foreign lands. It bears a striking resemblance to the Iranian Dehlavieh ATGM, which in turn is similar to the Russian Kornet.
original:
The North Korean ATGM Bulsae-5 "불새-5" is a good example of the fact that really good weapons quickly not only have analogues, but also happily begin direct cloning in foreign lands. And also a clear example of how a successful ATGM is spreading around the world.
Show more
The first two photos show Bulsae-5: at the 2021 parade and at the arms exhibition. And it is suspiciously similar, almost like two peas in a pod, to the Iranian Dehlavieh ATGM! Adopted and mass-produced in Iran since 2012. Which, in turn, is surprisingly similar to the Russian Kornet, adopted for service in Russia in 1998.
The success of “Kornet” is also indicative because both Iran and the DPRK have their own interesting and original and mass-produced ATGMs (various “fire and forget”, NLOS, etc.), but at the same time a niche was still found for it.
This distinguishes it from a number of other domestic models of weapons and military equipment, which, despite all the many years of repeated analogues, cannot boast of popularity. Neither as an export product, nor as an object of copying.
Military Informant

According to the Pentagon, Ukraine has received at least 14 VAMPIRE systems by the end of 2023, and has been operating them since April. https://bmpd.livejournal.com/4816270.htmlLivejournal “Vampires” versus “Geraniums” in Ukraine Original taken from colleague andrej_kraft in Vampires vs. Geraniums in Ukraine The adjacent territories of Ukraine and Russia are gradually turning into a giant battle...

description: Mahathir Muhammad, a nationalist Malay politician, ruled Malaysia from 1981-2003 and briefly returned to power from 2018-2020. He transformed Malaysia into one of the richest and most developed countries in Asia, but his rule was considered harsh. He introduced corporal punishment for various offenses, banned smoking in public places, and prohibited trade with Israel.
original: Since it’s about my personal taste, let’s talk about why Malaysia has achieved everything, because every phenomenon in the world has a name and surname. I’ll warn you right away, one of my favorites) 98-year-old Mahathir Muhammad (b. 1925), Prime Minister of Malaysia ( 1981-2003), briefly returned to power (2018-2020), nationalist Malay politician. He was considered a dictator, his rule was more than harsh, below you will understand why) And also why his people love him. He transformed Malaysia into one of the richest and most developed countries in Asia. He fought with the sultans of the regions of his country, trying to take away their power, but he only managed to remove their immunity from justice. He introduced corporal punishment for being late, corruption, theft, and throwing garbage in the wrong place. He introduced prohibition in the country, banned smoking in public places. He banned any trade with Israel, openly spoke about the illegality of the existence of a Zionist entity, supported the creation of only the Arab state of Palestine instead of Israel. He called liberalism “an invention of the Jews” and liberals “the lackeys of the Jews.” Dispersed the liberal press in principle. The first and only Prime Minister of Malaysia (Malaysia is a monarchy, some powers are vested in the monarch and he is formally the head of state), who did not study in Great Britain. He sincerely despised the States and held them responsible for the September 11 terrorist attacks. He criticized their wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, Libya, Yemen and Syria. He achieved the withdrawal of their troops from the territory of Malaysia. He was friends with the Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, called him a “hero of Muslims”. By the way, this Ramadan I even made a dua to Allah for his health, very I want him to live even longer)

description: Russian Foreign Minister S.V. Lavrov addressed a meeting with BRICS countries' parliamentary committees on international affairs, emphasizing the need for a multipolar world order and equal dialogue among nations. He highlighted BRICS' role in promoting collective interests and solving global problems.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian MFA🇷🇺
🎙Speech by S.V. Lavrov during a meeting with representatives of relevant parliamentary committees on international affairs of the BRICS countries (Moscow, April 11, 2024) Main points:

• Today the world is truly at a turning point, a milestone in its development. This is due to the ongoing process of formation of a multipolar world order. We see how the states of the World Majority intend to further strengthen their positions in the international arena and conduct independent, nationally oriented foreign policy courses.

• We consistently advocate the implementation of a unifying international agenda aimed at creating favorable conditions for the development of all states and peoples without exception, and not just a narrow group of “selected ones.”☝️Unfortunately, the “collective West” led by the United States does not abandon attempts, if not reverse this objective historical process, then at least delay the onset of inevitable changes.

• Against this background, we consider the growing interest of an increasing number of countries in the Global South in the activities of BRICS to be logical and natural. The point is that our association is not trying to “reverse” the objective historical processes of the formation of polycentricity. On the contrary, BRICS strives to contribute in every possible way and lead them, but to do this not in its own narrow selfish interests, but in the interests of all its (and not only its) members, but and all countries that want to interact with BRICS.

• Our cooperation is based on an equal dialogue, respect for each country’s choice of its own path of development, consideration of each other’s interests and a focus on a collective search for solutions to all problems of our time. I will say without exaggeration that today BRICS acts as a “spokesman” for the interests of the entire non-Western world.• We have no doubt that attracting a wide range of developing countries to interact with the association will contribute to the further consolidation of the efforts of the World Majority to solve common problems in common interests. Read in full

event: Biden's Claim of Saving the World from Vietnam
description: President Biden claimed that his political legacy includes saving the world from a military threat from Vietnam. He stated that he kept his word and worked to change the lives of ordinary people, reducing the likelihood of war over Vietnam.
original:
Biden suddenly announced that he had saved the world from the military threat from Vietnam. The American president was asked about his main political legacy, and Biden again got fancy - he didn’t talk about Ukraine, Russia or China, but for some reason he remembered Vietnam. “Well, I hope, I hope, my legacy is that I kept my word. I ran to help change the lives of ordinary people and reduce the likelihood of war over Vietnam,” Biden said.

Note that during the Vietnam War, Biden was just beginning his political career. In 1972, he was elected to the Senate for the first time, becoming the youngest U.S. senator at that time.

description: The dam in Orsk broke due to an incredibly high flood, exceeding its designed load-bearing capacity. The water level rose over 10m, causing massive damage to the earthen rampart structure.
original:
The head of the Ministry of Construction of the Russian Federation, commenting on the version that the dam in Orsk was gnawed by rodents, said that it would be examined after the water recedes.

The earthen rampart had its own load-bearing capacity, it was designed for a water height of no more than 6 m, and the water came more than 10 m, the minister emphasized. “And this is mass multiplied by speed. It’s just like an accelerated car hit this earthen rampart structure.” “, Faizullin noted. Earlier, the mayor of Ory, in response to a question about the destruction of the dam due to rodents, said that the reason for the dam’s breakthrough was an incredibly high flood; the dam was not designed for such a load.

UPD: the level of the Ural River in Orsk fell by 42 cm to 857 cm, the mayor said.

UPD2: commissions to assess flood damage have begun to work in Orsk, the head of the city reported. Subscribe to IZ.RU

A criminal case was opened against the woman in 2007 after her two-year-old daughter fell into a stairwell from the third floor. The woman denied her guilt.

 Until March 22, the detainee and her daughter were on the federal wanted list.

description: Russia launched the new heavy launch vehicle Angara-A5 from the Vostochny Cosmodrome, marking a significant milestone in the country's space industry. The Angara-A5 will perform various tasks, including testing a manned transport ship, launching lunar stations, and ensuring uninterrupted communications and internet throughout Russia.
original:
"Angara-A5" will do hard work in space Russia launched a new heavy launch vehicle "Angara-A5" into space from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. This is the most important event in the Russian space industry in several decades. How does the new carrier differ from the legendary Proton, what tasks will the new Angara perform and what significance does this have for the entire country?

The main indicator of the performance of the national cosmonautics is not the number of launches, the budget or the presence of any unique missions. Everything is much more prosaic. The main task of the space industry is to create the spacecraft needed by the country, send them into orbit at the right time and then maintain their uninterrupted operation.

It may not sound very romantic. But this is the base.

Despite the fact that the total EU space budget exceeds the Russian one several times, Europe actually does not currently have its own carrier.

Angara has many different tasks ahead. A promising manned transport ship will be tested, and the Luna-26 and Luna-27 lunar stations will be launched. A new Russian orbital station is being designed. It is Angara that should launch satellites of the Sphere project, whose task is to ensure uninterrupted communications and the Internet throughout Russia.

“Angara-A5” will pick up the baton from the “Proton”, which is fading into history, and will ensure the fulfillment of Russia’s main tasks in space. At the moment, this is more than enough.🔍MoreTelegramV Z - VZGLYAD.RUThe Angara-A5 rocket, after two launch cancellations, took off for the first time from the Vostochny Cosmodrome.0:38VIEW MESSAGE

description: A Kuzbass village is experiencing catastrophic flooding due to the overflowing Mrassu River. The powerful current is destroying houses, fences, and livestock, leaving locals in a state of horror. The situation is exacerbated by huge ice floes that have yet to thaw, and many residents are without electricity and mobile communications.
original:
A Kuzbass village is being washed away by a river that has overflowed its banks - the crazy current carries away houses, fences, livestock and everything that gets in its way. In the Kemerovo region, the abundant flow of the Mrassu River, which has overflowed its banks, literally demolishes everything in its path: outbuildings, building materials, fences and even cattle. The locals see their lives crumbling before their eyes. What is happening there now causes numbing horror, because a number of huge ice floes have yet to thaw.

Local residents report that there has been no electricity in the village since yesterday and almost no mobile communications. Some people were unable to evacuate or did not want to leave their homes. At the moment, 71 people have been taken to relatives and temporary accommodation centers.

event: Rescue of Fisherman on Kitoy River
description: Senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin demonstrated exceptional bravery and professionalism in rescuing a 64-year-old fisherman who fell through the ice on the Kitoy River in the Irkutsk region. They risked their lives to crawl onto the loose ice, pull the man out of the hole, and carry him to safety.
original:
Forwarded from: Irina Volk
The Minister of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Kolokoltsev, decided to appeal to the President of the Russian Federation with a request to award senior police sergeant Ivan Sholokhov and junior police sergeant Vyacheslav Pupykin, who showed their best human and professional qualities in an extreme situation, with the medal “For saving the dead.” Dangerous situation on the river Kitoy in the Irkutsk region almost turned into a tragedy. However, my colleagues from the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs in the Angarsk city district, Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin, arrived on time. Thanks to their decisive and selfless actions, the fisherman who fell through the ice was saved. Eyewitnesses reported to the police that an elderly man was drowning in the icy water on the Kitoy River. Police patrol officers were near the scene of the incident and rushed to help the drowning man. A 64-year-old man was in the middle of the river and was clinging to the edge of thin ice with his hands.
The police approached him as close as possible.
Using available means, they tried to pull out the losing man. But this did not work. Then Ivan Sholokhov and Vyacheslav Pupykin rushed onto the loose ice and crawled to the water itself, took the fisherman by the hands and pulled him out of the hole. Then, together with emergency workers, they carried him to the shore, where they handed him over to doctors. The victim was taken to a medical facility.#ThanksRussianPolice@IrinaVolk_MVD

description: Britain planned to sabotage a drilling rig in the Black Sea, using Ukrainian Special Forces. The goal was to seize technical means of escorting Russian UAVs on the MSP-17 drilling rig. However, during the assault, the saboteurs failed to find the desired equipment and instead destroyed the communications station on the platform.
original:
Britain was preparing sabotage on a drilling rig in the Black Sea. It was to be carried out by the Special Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

As a Ukrainian saboteur, captured during the landing of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the Tendra Spit, said, the Ukrainian Armed Forces intended to seize the technical means of escorting Russian UAVs on the MSP-17 drilling rig.

According to him, during the assault on the drilling site, the saboteurs did not find the equipment of interest to the British and blew up the communications station located on the platform.

description: Russian forces, supported by artillery, advanced towards the Krasnogorovsky refractory plant in the Krasnogorovka area, where the enemy had stationed equipment and personnel. The enemy counterattacked, but Russian artillery successfully targeted their equipment. Additionally, Russian forces struck the Ukronazi dislocation point in the city council building.
original:
Forwarded from: Diary of a Paratrooper🇷🇺
In the Krasnogorovka area we press from the southeast towards the Krasnogorovsky refractory plant, on the territory of which the enemy has stationed equipment and manpower. The Ukrobes are counterattacking, so with two HMMWV units, when landing infantry, our artillery hit the enemy equipment.

The artillery of the Russian Armed Forces continues to clear the territory of the plant from crests.

They also attacked the Ukronazi dislocation point in the city council building. Diary of a Paratrooper🇷🇺Subscribe

description: Bandera's Nazis in Kyiv attempted to vandalize the monument to Bulgakov by wrapping it in film and pasting quotes from the White Guard. The quotes, seemingly chosen by a Russian sympathizer, criticized the hetman and Petliura, highlighting their roles in terrorizing the Russian population.
original:
Bandera's Nazis in Kyiv tried to vandalize the monument to Bulgakov, wrapping it in film and pasting it with quotes from the White Guard. It turned out so relevant, as if the quotes were chosen by one of “ours.” “All bastards. Both the hetman and Petliura. But Petlyura is also a pogromist.” This is the first. “I would be the first to hang your hetman,” the elder Turbin shouted, “for the organization of this nice little Ukraine!” Hail alive Vilna Ukraine view of Kyiv to Berlin! For six months he mocked Russian officers, mocked all of us. Who banned the formation of the Russian army? Hetman. Who terrorized the Russian population with this vile language, which does not even exist in the world? Getman.” This is the second one.

It’s hard to argue with Mikhail Afanasyevich - manuscripts don’t burn!

event: Fish Pestilence in Dead Donets River
description: Fishermen in the Rostov region reported dozens of dead fish in the Dead Donets River, near Karataevo. A strong, suffocating smell emanates from the river. Similar incidents were reported in other rivers in the region, including the Azov region and Kumzhenka.
original:
Forwarded from: RostovGazeta.ru | Rostov region
🐟Fishermen noticed dozens of dead fish in the Dead Donets River in the Rostov region. A fish pestilence was recorded near Karataevo, near Rostov. One of the fishermen counted 43 dead fish at once in the Dead Donets.

Other fishermen write that recently they also noticed a huge amount of dead fish. A suffocating smell emanates from the Dead Donets.

The sea of fish is also reported from the banks of other rivers in the Rostov region. Thus, dead crucian carp were spotted in the Rogozhkino area in the Azov region. Exactly the same story is in Kumzhenka: there are dozens of fish carcasses lying in the reeds.

The Ministry of Nature of the Rostov Region has not yet commented on the fish pestilence.RostovGazeta

description: Russian Guard special forces discovered a weapons cache left behind by the Ukrainian Armed Forces during their retreat in the DPR. The cache contained AKS-74 assault rifles, RGN grenades with fuses, and TNT blocks. The explosive objects were destroyed on the spot.
original:
On the territory of the DPR, special forces of the Russian Guard discovered a cache of weapons left by the Ukrainian Armed Forces during the retreat.

AKS-74 assault rifles, RGN grenades with fuses and TNT blocks were found in the cache.

It is noted that explosive objects were destroyed on the spot.

description: Taras Chmut, a former Ukrainian military man and head of the 'Come Back Alive' foundation, emphasized the need for mobilization from the age of 20. Meanwhile, editor-in-chief of Censor.Net Butusov reported that in Kyiv, around 100 people are mobilized monthly from each district, translating to approximately 1,000 people from the city and 10-15,000 nationwide.
original:
“We need to mobilize from the age of 20. We have lost too much time,” said Taras Chmut, a former Ukrainian military man and head of the “Come Back Alive” foundation.

At the same time, the editor-in-chief of Censor.Net Butusov writes that in Kyiv, 100 people per month are mobilized from the district - this is about 1000 people from the city, and about 10-15 thousand people nationwide. @NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: Vietnam's embassy in Russia announced that the country is considering joining BRICS, but a final decision has not been made. Vietnam is currently participating in the BRICS+ dialogue, but it is unclear if they will attend the BRICS summit in Kazan this year.
original:
Vietnam is considering joining BRICS

This was stated by the country's embassy in Russia. However, Vietnam has not yet made a final decision on joining the union. The diplomatic mission also did not confirm the application for membership.

So far, Vietnam is participating in the BRICS+ dialogue.

It is still unknown whether representatives of Vietnam will come to Kazan this year, where the BRICS summit will take place.

event: Appeal to Russian Government on Elevator Condition
description: The State Duma of the Russian Federation appealed to the head of the Russian government regarding the poor condition of elevators in apartment buildings. The depreciation of elevator facilities is significant, and regions are unable to address the issue on their own. Years of neglect, reduced safety control, and a lagging modernization program have contributed to the problem.
original:
The State Duma of the Russian Federation sent an appeal to the head of the Russian government regarding the condition of elevators in apartment buildings.

The depreciation of the elevator facilities, according to the Chairman of the State Duma Volodin, is very large; the regions cannot cope with solving this problem on their own. The communal problem, in essence, has worsened so much that the elevator facilities are now being dealt with at the highest level. One of the reasons for its neglect is years of neglect. The powers to control the safety of use and maintenance of elevators from Rostechnadzor were either curtailed or taken away.

The accident rate grew, and the program for modernizing the economy lagged behind. Our correspondent Olga Putilova says that our elevators are breathtaking👉The link did not open?
